original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: brtson 'grus la rab tu 'bad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' lnga brgya po de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid kyi rgyu dang / rkyen gyis tshe 'phos nas thams cad shar phyogs su sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di nas khri phrag bcu 'das pa'i pha rol gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skyes so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus la rab tu 'bad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' lnga brgya po de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid kyi rgyu dang / rkyen gyis tshe 'phos nas thams cad shar phyogs su sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di nas khri phrag bcu 'das pa'i pha rol gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skyes so //
translated: Those five hundred bodhisattvas who were striving in diligence, by the cause and condition of that root of virtue, after their lives ended, were reborn in a buddhafield ten myriads of buddhafields to the east of this buddhafield, by the power of the purity of their wisdom.

original: der skyes nas chos de la nan tan byas pas ring po mi thogs par sngon gyi gnas dran te dbang po rnon por gyur to //
analyzed: der skyes nas chos de la nan tan byas pas ring po mi thogs par sngon gyi gnas dran te dbang po rnon por gyur to //
translated: After being born there, he diligently practiced the Dharma, and before long he remembered his past lives and became one of sharp faculties.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na tshad med pa'i me tog @23b brtsegs pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa da ltar bzhugs te 'tsho skyong zhing chos ston to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na tshad med pa'i me tog @23b brtsegs pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa da ltar bzhugs te 'tsho skyong zhing chos ston to //
translated: In that buddha-land, the Tathāgata called King of Immeasurable Flower-Piles is presently living, sustaining himself, teaching the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag lo bcu drug lon nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag lo bcu drug lon nas /
translated: Those bodhisattvas, when they reached the age of sixteen,

original: bcom ldan 'das chod med pa'i me tog brtsegs pa'i rgyal po'i bstan pa la rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chod med pa'i me tog brtsegs pa'i rgyal po'i bstan pa la rab tu byung ste /
translated: went forth under the teaching of the Blessed One King of Immeasurable Flower-Piles.

original: lo khri phrag drug cu'i bar du gzhon nur tshangs par spyad pa spyod cing de lta bu'i brtson 'grus la nan tan byed do //
analyzed: lo khri phrag drug cu'i bar du gzhon nur tshangs par spyad pa spyod cing de lta bu'i brtson 'grus la nan tan byed do //
translated: For sixty thousand years, they practiced celibacy as youths and diligently practiced such perseverance.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapāla,

original: byang chub sems dpa' lnga brgya po de dag da ltar de bzhin gshegs pa khri phrag nyi shu dang phrad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lnga brgya po de dag da ltar de bzhin gshegs pa khri phrag nyi shu dang phrad de /
translated: those five hundred bodhisattvas have now met with twenty thousand tathāgatas.

original: bcom ldan 'das de dag gi spyan sngar brtson 'grus shin tu brtsams pas dran pa dang / bde ba dang / shes rab phul du gyur pa dang ldan par gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de dag gi spyan sngar brtson 'grus shin tu brtsams pas dran pa dang / bde ba dang / shes rab phul du gyur pa dang ldan par gyur to //
translated: In the presence of those buddhas, they exerted themselves with great diligence and attained the highest mindfulness, bliss, and wisdom.

original: tha ma bcom ldan 'das tshad med pa stobs mtho ba'i rgyal po zhes bya ba dang phrad nas bcom ldan 'das des lung bstan pa /
analyzed: tha ma bcom ldan 'das tshad med pa stobs mtho ba'i rgyal po zhes bya ba dang phrad nas bcom ldan 'das des lung bstan pa /
translated: In the end, they encountered the Bhagavān named Immeasurable King of Lofty Power. That Bhagavān prophesied:

original: khyed bskal pa khri 'das nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o zhes lung bstan to //
analyzed: khyed bskal pa khri 'das nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o zhes lung bstan to //

original: byang chub sems dpa' lnga brgya po de dag kyang bskal pa khri'i bar du sangs rgyas stong phrag gnyis dang phrad nas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub yongs su rdzogs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lnga brgya po de dag kyang bskal pa khri'i bar du sangs rgyas stong phrag gnyis dang phrad nas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub yongs su rdzogs te /
translated: Those five hundred bodhisattvas encountered two thousand buddhas over ten thousand eons, and they perfected the enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: bskal pa gcig la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: bskal pa gcig la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas so //
translated: In a single eon, they fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.”

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokapālas,

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @24a *//
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @24a *//
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas quickly attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod pa dag rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi stobs la de ltar mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bag byed pa bskyed par rig par bya'o; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod pa dag rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi stobs la de ltar mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bag byed pa bskyed par rig par bya'o; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Therefore, know that bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to quickly attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment should generate such aspiration, diligence, and effort toward the power of pure wisdom. And why?

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapāla,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i rtsa ba ni mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bag byed pa dang / gzhan yang byang chub kyi tshogs su gyur pa'i chos gang sangs rgyas kyi chos phun sum tshogs par byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i rtsa ba ni mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bag byed pa dang / gzhan yang byang chub kyi tshogs su gyur pa'i chos gang sangs rgyas kyi chos phun sum tshogs par byed pa rnams so //
translated: the root of the buddhas’ attainment of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment is aspiration, diligence, effort, and other factors that contribute to enlightenment, which bring about the perfection of the buddhas’ qualities.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapāla,

original: ngas de lta bu'i brtson 'grus kyis sangs rgyas khri phrag nyi shu dang phrad de /
analyzed: ngas de lta bu'i brtson 'grus kyis sangs rgyas khri phrag nyi shu dang phrad de /
translated: through such diligence, I encountered two hundred thousand buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas de dag gi chos kyang skye ba'i gnas thams cad du dran pa dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas de dag gi chos kyang skye ba'i gnas thams cad du dran pa dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: They will remember the Dharma of those buddhas in all their lives.

original: skye ba'i gnas thams cad du sngon gyi gnas dran pas chos 'di bsgom pa la bar chad med de /
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas thams cad du sngon gyi gnas dran pas chos 'di bsgom pa la bar chad med de /
translated: In all their lives, they will remember their past lives and will not be interrupted in their cultivation of this Dharma.

original: ngas mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bag byas pa las ma nyams pas rtag tu mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bag yod pa dang ldan par gyur to //
analyzed: ngas mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bag byas pa las ma nyams pas rtag tu mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bag yod pa dang ldan par gyur to //
translated: I never let my faith, diligence, and conscientiousness decline, and so I always had faith, diligence, and conscientiousness.”

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das thugs rje dang byams pa chen po'i thugs kyis phyogs bzhir gzigs nas mngon par shes pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu bstan te /

translated: At that time, the Bhagavān, with a mind of great compassion and love, looked in the four directions and displayed the power of his supernormal knowledge and miracles.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dzambu'i gling kun tu sprul pa'i sangs rgyas dag bzhugs shing sems can rnams la sems @24b can thams cad kyi the tshom gcod cing /

translated: In all the Jambudvīpas of the trichiliocosm, emanated buddhas were present, resolving the doubts of all beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems bku bar byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod ces bya ba'i mdo ston par gyur to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems bku bar byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod ces bya ba'i mdo ston par gyur to //
translated: He then expounded the sutra called The Bodhisattva Canon, which extols the minds of all sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang / rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus 'od ma'i tshal gyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor kun kyang sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyis dzambu'i gling gang ba bzhugs shing so so nas dam pa'i chos ston par mthong nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus 'od ma'i tshal gyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor kun kyang sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyis dzambu'i gling gang ba bzhugs shing so so nas dam pa'i chos ston par mthong nas /
translated: Moreover, by the power of his supernormal knowledge, he caused the entire assembly in the grove of Ghosila to see the entire world filled with emanated buddhas, each of whom was expounding the sublime Dharma.

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams rab tu dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams rab tu dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: The assembly was overjoyed.

analyzed: 'dug pa las langs nas sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal te 'di skad du ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: They rose from their seats, bowed to the Buddha, and exclaimed, “How marvelous!

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu bsam gyis mi khyab bo //

analyzed: tshad med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos lhun gyis grub bo zhes smras so //

analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor mang po rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: At that time, the Bhagavān said to the great assembly,

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: “Noble sons,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i dngos po 'di dag ngo mtshar che ba ma yin no //
translated: These things taught by the Tathagata are not at all marvelous.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chos nyid thugs su chud pas ba spu'i khung bu gcig nas kyang mngon par shes pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus 'od zer bkye nas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang bar mdzad cing chos kyi gsung sgrogs kyang pa
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos nyid thugs su chud pas ba spu'i khung bu gcig nas kyang mngon par shes pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus 'od zer bkye nas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang bar mdzad cing chos kyi gsung sgrogs kyang pa
translated: The Tathagata, having realized the nature of dharmas, emits a ray of light from a single pore, and by the power of the supernormal faculties of that ray of light, he illuminates the worlds of the ten directions, as many as the sands of the Ganges River, and proclaims the Dharma.

original: spu'i khung bu gcig nas bstan pa'i brgya stong gi cha gcig tsam yang rdzogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: spu'i khung bu gcig nas bstan pa'i brgya stong gi cha gcig tsam yang rdzogs pa ma yin te /
translated: But even a hundred thousand times that is not even a fraction of what is taught from a single pore.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni de ltar bsam @25a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni de ltar bsam @25a *//
translated: The Tathagata is like this.

original: gyis mi khyab pa'i yon tan lhun gyis grub pa'o //
analyzed: gyis mi khyab pa'i yon tan lhun gyis grub pa'o //
translated: His inconceivable qualities are spontaneously accomplished.

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can de dag gi bsam pa thugs su chud pas de la chos ston to //
translated: The Tathagata teaches the Dharma to those beings by understanding their thoughts.

original: rigs kyi bu rnams /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rnams /
translated: Sons of good family!

analyzed: da ltar gyi dus kyi sems can de dag ni chos 'di spyod pa la mos pa nyung ngo //
translated: The beings of this present time have little interest in practicing this teaching.

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag da ltar gyi dus kyi sems can dag ni chos 'di la bag byed par spyod pa'ang nyung ngo //

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: dus ngan pa'i sems can dag ni chos 'di la spyod pa'ang rab tu nyung ngo //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnyog pa lnga'i 'jig rten ngan par 'byung ngo //
translated: The Thus-Gone One appears in a world with five degenerations:

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: sems can gyi rnyog pa dang / lta ba'i rnyog pa dang / tshe'i rnyog pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa dang / bskal pa'i rnyog pa'o //
translated: the degeneration of beings, the degeneration of views, the degeneration of lifespan, the degeneration of afflictions, and the degeneration of the eon.

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: Sons of noble family,

analyzed: chung ngu na sems can 'ga' zhig shin tu zab mo rnam par dag pa'i chos 'di la yid ches te /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi shes rab la phyin par byed na de ni shin tu ngo mtshar che ba yin na de bzhin gshegs pa spyod yul la mos pa lta ci smos /
translated: and were to attain the wisdom of the Buddha, that would be a most wondrous thing. How much more so if one were to believe in the sphere of experience of the Tathagata?

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: “Noble sons,

original: nga rtag tu yun ring bo nas de lta bu'i smon lam gyis brgyan cing de lta bu'i brtson 'grus dang / bzod pa byas pa'ang sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba'i sems can @25b mgon med pa dang / skyabs med pa dang / ngan song du ltung ba dag gi phyir ro //
analyzed: nga rtag tu yun ring bo nas de lta bu'i smon lam gyis brgyan cing de lta bu'i brtson 'grus dang / bzod pa byas pa'ang sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba'i sems can @25b mgon med pa dang / skyabs med pa dang / ngan song du ltung ba dag gi phyir ro //
translated: for a long time I have been adorned with such aspirations, and I have practiced such diligence and patience for the sake of sentient beings who are tormented by suffering, who are without a protector, without a refuge, and who have fallen into the lower realms.

analyzed: nga de'i tshe na mngon par sangs rgyas nas skye bo grangs med tshad med pa dag la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don byas so; ;rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: When I attained perfect buddhahood, I benefited and brought happiness to countless sentient beings.🔽“Noble sons,

analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi rnam par dag pa'i smon lam dang / brtson 'grus kyi byin gyis sems can grangs med tshad med pa rnams 'di lta bu'i shin tu zab mo'i chos la dad cing yid ches pa dang / gzungs su 'dzin par gyur to //
translated: Therefore, by the power of the Tathagata's original pure vows and his diligent practice, innumerable sentient beings have come to believe in and uphold this profound Dharma.

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: Sons of good family!

original: ngas sngon btul ba'i sems can dag nga'i chos 'di la yid ches par gyur to //
analyzed: ngas sngon btul ba'i sems can dag nga'i chos 'di la yid ches par gyur to //
translated: Those sentient beings whom I have previously taught have come to believe in this Dharma of mine.

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: Sons of good family!

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhis sems can dag 'di lta bu'i shin tu zab mo'i chos la yid ches par byas pa nyung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhis sems can dag 'di lta bu'i shin tu zab mo'i chos la yid ches par byas pa nyung ngo //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have used the four forms of fearlessness and the ten powers to cause only a few sentient beings to believe in this profound Dharma.

original: sems can gang chos 'di la gnas pa ni kun kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa'i mthu dang / thabs kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: sems can gang chos 'di la gnas pa ni kun kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa'i mthu dang / thabs kyi dbang gis so //
translated: Those sentient beings who abide in this Dharma are all by the power of the Tathagata's intention and skillful means.

original: nga ni yun ring po nas de lta bu'i chos zab mo dang ma bral bas yun ring po nas byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen pos sems can dag rjes su bzung ste ma btang ngo //
analyzed: nga ni yun ring po nas de lta bu'i chos zab mo dang ma bral bas yun ring po nas byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen pos sems can dag rjes su bzung ste ma btang ngo //
translated: I have long been inseparable from such profound Dharma, and for a long time I have not abandoned the great love, great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity that I have used to care for sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnyog pa lnga'i 'jig rten ngan par sems can la phan pa'i don mdzad pa nyung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnyog pa lnga'i 'jig rten ngan par sems can la phan pa'i don mdzad pa nyung ngo //
translated: The Tathāgata has done few things to benefit sentient beings in this evil world of the five turbidities.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: Sons of good family,

original: nga sngon brtson 'grus chen po'i shugs dang / thabs mkhas pa @26a *//
analyzed: nga sngon brtson 'grus chen po'i shugs dang / thabs mkhas pa @26a *//
translated: in the past I used the power of great diligence and the power of great skillful means

original: chen po'i mthus sems can gyi don byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi tshogs bsags so //
analyzed: chen po'i mthus sems can gyi don byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi tshogs bsags so //
translated: to benefit sentient beings and accumulate the provisions for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: Sons of good family,

original: ngas mngon du dran pa sngon 'das pa'i dus na sems can la phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir nyi ma gcig la'ang lus stong yongs su btang ste sbyin pa byas so //

translated: I remember that in the past, for the sake of benefiting and bringing happiness to sentient beings, I gave away my body a thousand times in a single day, practicing generosity.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

I divided my relics and displayed my miraculous powers, even down to the finest particles the size of mustard seeds.

analyzed: sems rnam par dag pas gnas thams cad du smon pa bzhin du 'grub bo //

analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
