original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpas phung po lnga la sbyor ba rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpas phung po lnga la sbyor ba rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
translated: how are bodhisattvas skilled in discerning the five aggregates?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la yang dag par rtog pa ni 'di @31b lta ste; ma rig pa'i phung po ni nye bar len pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la yang dag par rtog pa ni 'di @31b lta ste; ma rig pa'i phung po ni nye bar len pa'i phung po'o //
translated: Bodhisattva mahāsattvas correctly contemplate the five appropriated aggregates as follows: The aggregate of ignorance is an appropriated aggregate.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po ni nye bar len pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po ni nye bar len pa'i phung po'o //
translated: The aggregate of suffering is an appropriated aggregate.

original: gti mug gi phung po ni nye bar len pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: gti mug gi phung po ni nye bar len pa'i phung po'o //
translated: The aggregate of delusion is an appropriated aggregate.

original: nad kyi phung po dang / shu pa'i phung po dang / zug rdu'i phung po ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: nad kyi phung po dang / shu pa'i phung po dang / zug rdu'i phung po ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: The five appropriated aggregates are the aggregate of illness, the aggregate of boils, and the aggregate of pain.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po rnam par 'byed pa la brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po rnam par 'byed pa la brtag par bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas should investigate the differentiation of the form aggregate.

original: de la gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po rnam par 'byed pa la ji ltar brtag ce na /
analyzed: de la gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po rnam par 'byed pa la ji ltar brtag ce na /
translated: How should they investigate the differentiation of the form aggregate?

original: gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po de ni chen po bzhi las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po de ni chen po bzhi las skyes pa ste /
translated: That form aggregate arises from the four great elements.

original: gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes btags pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes btags pa tsam du zad do //
translated: It is merely designated as the form aggregate.

original: gzugs kyi phung po la rang bzhin med de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la rang bzhin med de /
translated: The form aggregate has no intrinsic nature.

original: chen po bzhi 'dus par zad pas gzugs kyi phung po zhes btags pa tsam mo //
analyzed: chen po bzhi 'dus par zad pas gzugs kyi phung po zhes btags pa tsam mo //
translated: It is merely designated as the form aggregate because of the aggregation of the four great elements.

original: gzugs kyi phung po ni byas pa med pa /🔽byed pa med pa /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po ni byas pa med pa / byed pa med pa /
translated: The form aggregate is not made,🔽not a maker,

original: bya ba med pa /
analyzed: bya ba med pa /
translated: not an action,

original: 'byung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba med pa'o //
translated: and not an element.

original: gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi las kyi rgyu dang / rkyen dang / chen po bzhi 'dus pa las gzugs kyi phung po zhes btags pa tsam du zad kyi phung po ma yin pa de gzugs kyi phung po yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi las kyi rgyu dang / rkyen dang / chen po bzhi 'dus pa las gzugs kyi phung po zhes btags pa tsam du zad kyi phung po ma yin pa de gzugs kyi phung po yin no //
translated: The so-called aggregate of form is merely a designation based on the causes and conditions of past karma and the combination of the four great elements. It is not an aggregate, yet it is called the aggregate of form.

original: dper na / nam mkha'i phung po dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha'i phung po dang 'dra ste /
translated: It is like the aggregate of space.

original: yang dag pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: yang dag pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid med do //
translated: It has no characteristic of true arising.

original: gang nam mkha'i phung po zhes brjod pa de la chos gang yang ma skyes te; ming tsam yod pa'i phyir nam mkha'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang nam mkha'i phung po zhes brjod pa de la chos gang yang ma skyes te; ming tsam yod pa'i phyir nam mkha'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is called the aggregate of space is not a dharma that arises. It is called the aggregate of space because it is merely a name.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bos phung po dang / phung po'i mtshan nyid med pa 'di la phyin ci log gi sems kyis yang dag pa ma yin par @32a *//
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bos phung po dang / phung po'i mtshan nyid med pa 'di la phyin ci log gi sems kyis yang dag pa ma yin par @32a *//
translated: Foolish ordinary beings, with their mistaken minds, grasp at what is not real in this absence of aggregates and the characteristics of aggregates.

original: yang dag par 'dzin te /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin te /
translated: They grasp at what is not real as real.

original: bdag phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: bdag phung po lnga'o //
translated: They say, ‘The self is the five aggregates.

original: bdag gi phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: bdag gi phung po lnga'o //
translated: The self possesses the five aggregates.

original: bdag gzugs kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: bdag gzugs kyi phung po'o //
translated: The self is the aggregate of form.’

original: bdag gi gzugs kyi phung po zhes de ltar zhen to //
analyzed: bdag gi gzugs kyi phung po zhes de ltar zhen to //
translated: They think, “This is my form aggregate.”

original: de ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo dag gzugs la zhen nas gzugs la bdag dang / bdag gi ba dang / gzugs yod pa dang / gzugs su 'dzin pa dang / gzugs su len pa dang / gzugs la zhen pa dag gzugs la gnas shing rten te sdig pa mi dge ba'i las rnam pa sna tshogs spyod cing myong bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo dag gzugs la zhen nas gzugs la bdag dang / bdag gi ba dang / gzugs yod pa dang / gzugs su 'dzin pa dang / gzugs su len pa dang / gzugs la zhen pa dag gzugs la gnas shing rten te sdig pa mi dge ba'i las rnam pa sna tshogs spyod cing myong bar byed do //
translated: In this way, foolish ordinary beings, attached to form, think of form as “I” and “mine,” as “existing,” as “grasped,” as “that which is appropriated,” and as “that to which one is attached.” They rely on form and, based on form, they engage in and experience various nonvirtuous actions.

original: bdag cag gis ni byis pa so so'i skye bo'i rjes su bslab pa'i mi rigs kyi /
analyzed: bdag cag gis ni byis pa so so'i skye bo'i rjes su bslab pa'i mi rigs kyi /
translated: “It is not right for us to follow the example of foolish ordinary beings.

original: bdag cag gis brtson 'grus bskyed de /
analyzed: bdag cag gis brtson 'grus bskyed de /
translated: We must arouse diligence

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsgom pa la nan tan bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsgom pa la nan tan bya'o //
translated: and apply ourselves to cultivating the factors of awakening.

original: gzugs kyi phung po la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin brtag par bya ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin brtag par bya ba'i rigs so //
translated: It is right for us to examine the form aggregate just as it is.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phung po la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtog pa'i tshe chu'i dbu ba dang 'dra bar shes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phung po la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtog pa'i tshe chu'i dbu ba dang 'dra bar shes so //
translated: When bodhisattvas investigate the aggregates correctly and in accordance with reality, they understand them to be like bubbles of water.

original: de la ji ltar na chu'i dbu ba dang 'dra bar shes pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na chu'i dbu ba dang 'dra bar shes pa zhe na /
translated: How do they understand them to be like bubbles of water?

original: dbu ba med pa ni chu'i dbu ba ste /
analyzed: dbu ba med pa ni chu'i dbu ba ste /
translated: Bubbles of water are not bubbles;

original: de'ang rkyen mang po las skyes su zad kyi bzung zhing bcad du mi bzod /
analyzed: de'ang rkyen mang po las skyes su zad kyi bzung zhing bcad du mi bzod /
translated: they are simply produced from many conditions, and they cannot withstand being grasped or popped.

original: sra ba 'am /
analyzed: sra ba 'am /
translated: They are not solid

original: snying po med pas chu'i dbu ba de la dbu ba'i mtshan nyid med de /
analyzed: snying po med pas chu'i dbu ba de la dbu ba'i mtshan nyid med de /
translated: and have no core. Bubbles of water have no characteristics of bubbles.

original: gang dbu ba med pa la chu'i dbu ba zhes bya ba bzhin du gzugs kyi phung po'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: gang dbu ba med pa la chu'i dbu ba zhes bya ba bzhin du gzugs kyi phung po'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as something that is not a bubble is called a bubble of water, so it is with the form aggregate.

original: gzugs kyi phung po la phung po'i mtshan nyid @32b med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la phung po'i mtshan nyid @32b med do //
translated: The form aggregate has no characteristics of an aggregate.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams de ltar rtog pa'i tshe 'di snyam du 'di bus pa so so'i skye bo ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i gzugs la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi rtogs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams de ltar rtog pa'i tshe 'di snyam du 'di bus pa so so'i skye bo ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i gzugs la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi rtogs /
translated: When bodhisattvas investigate in this way, they think, “These childish ordinary beings do not correctly investigate unreal form as it is.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs mi rtag par mi shes /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs mi rtag par mi shes /
translated: They do not know the impermanence of form as it really is.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs kyi mtshan nyid mi shes so snyam nas /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs kyi mtshan nyid mi shes so snyam nas /
translated: They do not know the characteristics of form as they really are.

original: bdag cag yang dag pa'i lam la zhugs pas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i gzugs la zhen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag cag yang dag pa'i lam la zhugs pas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i gzugs la zhen par mi bya'o //
translated: We who have entered the true path should not cling to unreal form.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gzugs zhen par bya ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs zhen par bya ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Form is not characterized by clinging.

original: ming tsam du zad kyi nges pa'i mtshan nyid med do //🔽de ltar gzugs ni nges pa'i mtshan nyid med cing ming dang yang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ming tsam du zad kyi nges pa'i mtshan nyid med do // de ltar gzugs ni nges pa'i mtshan nyid med cing ming dang yang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: It is merely a name, without a definite characteristic.

original: gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: In this way, form is said to be without a definite characteristic and free from names.

original: yang gzhan du na gzugs ni 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang gzhan du na gzugs ni 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: Moreover, form is characterized by destruction.

original: mkhas pa dag gis ni khong du chud pas mtshan ma med par shes so //🔽bdag cag gis gzugs mtshan ma med pa'i sbyor ba bsgom pa la mkhas par bya yi /
analyzed: mkhas pa dag gis ni khong du chud pas mtshan ma med par shes so // bdag cag gis gzugs mtshan ma med pa'i sbyor ba bsgom pa la mkhas par bya yi /
translated: The wise understand it as signless.🔽We should be skilled in cultivating the practice of form as signless.

original: gzugs kyi mtshan ma la zhen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan ma la zhen par mi bya'o //
translated: We should not cling to the signs of form.

original: gang zag gang zhig gzugs kyi mtshan ma la zhen na gzugs la zhen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag gang zhig gzugs kyi mtshan ma la zhen na gzugs la zhen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: If a person is attached to the characteristics of form, it is called attachment to form.

original: bdag cag gis gzugs kyi mtshan mar 'jug pa la shin tu mkhas par bya'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' de ltar yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin rtog pa de'i tshe yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gzugs rnam par 'byed pa rtogs nas gzugs kyi phung po de'ang gang bus pa so so'i skye bo dag gis rnam @33a *//
analyzed: bdag cag gis gzugs kyi mtshan mar 'jug pa la shin tu mkhas par bya'o // byang chub sems dpa' de ltar yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin rtog pa de'i tshe yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gzugs rnam par 'byed pa rtogs nas gzugs kyi phung po de'ang gang bus pa so so'i skye bo dag gis rnam @33a *//
translated: We should become very skilled in engaging with the characteristics of form.

original: par brtags pa'i 'du shes las byung bar shes so //
analyzed: par brtags pa'i 'du shes las byung bar shes so //
translated: When bodhisattvas correctly investigate in this way, they realize the discernment of form as it truly is. They understand that the aggregate of form arises from the discernment of ordinary, childish beings who conceptualize it.

original: de ltar chos rnams rnam par brtags pa'i 'du shes las byung bas de ni ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar chos rnams rnam par brtags pa'i 'du shes las byung bas de ni ma skyes pa ste /
translated: Since phenomena arise from the discernment of conceptualization, they are unborn.

original: rnam par brtags pa'i 'du shes thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i bus pa so so'i skye bo phyin ci log la rten cing gnas nas gzugs zhes skyed de /
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i 'du shes thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i bus pa so so'i skye bo phyin ci log la rten cing gnas nas gzugs zhes skyed de /
translated: All conceptualization is false. Ordinary, childish beings rely on and abide in error, and so they give rise to the notion of form.

original: gzugs kyis rnam par bcings so; ;gzugs kyis gtses pas sdug bsngal gyis gdungs te 'khor bar gyur to //
analyzed: gzugs kyis rnam par bcings so; ;gzugs kyis gtses pas sdug bsngal gyis gdungs te 'khor bar gyur to //
translated: They are tormented by form, and so they are burned by suffering and wander in saṃsāra.

original: ma rig pa dang / gti mug gis ldongs pas gzugs su zhen te mi gtod nas gzugs la rtag pa dang; sra ba dang / snying po yod par lta bas de ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo gzugs kyi 'ching bas bcings te /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / gti mug gis ldongs pas gzugs su zhen te mi gtod nas gzugs la rtag pa dang; sra ba dang / snying po yod par lta bas de ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo gzugs kyi 'ching bas bcings te /
translated: They are blinded by ignorance and delusion, and so they cling to form and are not liberated. They view form as permanent, solid, and having an essence. In this way, foolish, ordinary beings are bound by the fetters of form.

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song dang / yi dvags dang / lha dang mir rgyun du 'khor ro //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song dang / yi dvags dang / lha dang mir rgyun du 'khor ro //
translated: They continuously circle in the realms of hell beings, animals, pretas, gods, and humans.

original: gzugs kyi ri la shin tu chags te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi ri la shin tu chags te /
translated: They are extremely attached to the mountain of form.

original: gzugs de la nyes pa'i skyon mang po yod par mi lta'o //
analyzed: gzugs de la nyes pa'i skyon mang po yod par mi lta'o //
translated: They do not see the many faults and flaws in form.

original: bdag cag gis bus pa so so'i skye bo'i rjes su bslab par mi bya yi /
analyzed: bdag cag gis bus pa so so'i skye bo'i rjes su bslab par mi bya yi /
translated: We should not follow the example of foolish, ordinary beings.

original: gzugs kyi sbyor ba rnam par 'byed pa bsgom pa la brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sbyor ba rnam par 'byed pa bsgom pa la brtag par bya'o //
translated: We should investigate the cultivation of the discernment of the application of form.

original: gzugs rnam par 'byed pa la rtog pa'i tshe gzugs kyi rang bzhin rmi lam dang 'dra bar mthong ngo; ;'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzugs rnam par 'byed pa la rtog pa'i tshe gzugs kyi rang bzhin rmi lam dang 'dra bar mthong ngo; ;'di lta ste /
translated: When investigating the discernment of form, one sees the nature of form to be like a dream.

original: rmi lam gyi nang na gzugs mthong ba de ni rnam par brtags pa'i 'du shes tshor ba dang / rtog pa las skyes te /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi nang na gzugs mthong ba de ni rnam par brtags pa'i 'du shes tshor ba dang / rtog pa las skyes te /
translated: The forms seen in a dream arise from the conceptualization of discernment, sensation, and thought.

original: mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / tshor ba dang / @33b shes pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'ang skyed de /
analyzed: mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / tshor ba dang / @33b shes pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'ang skyed de /
translated: They give rise to seeing, hearing, sensation, and cognition, and to dependent origination.

original: bdag dang / gzhan du'ang shes so //
analyzed: bdag dang / gzhan du'ang shes so //
translated: One knows them to be self and other.

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung du'ang mthong ngo //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung du'ang mthong ngo //
translated: One sees them to be earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: ri dang / chu dang / nags tshal la sogs par mthong ste /
analyzed: ri dang / chu dang / nags tshal la sogs par mthong ste /
translated: One sees them to be mountains, rivers, forests, and so on.

original: de ltar rmi lam gyis gzugs kyi mtshan ma de la nges par chad pa med de /
analyzed: de ltar rmi lam gyis gzugs kyi mtshan ma de la nges par chad pa med de /
translated: In this way, the characteristics of forms in a dream are not definite.

original: rnam par brtags pa'i 'du shes las gzugs kyi phung po'i mtshan mar skyed pa'ang de bzhin te /
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i 'du shes las gzugs kyi phung po'i mtshan mar skyed pa'ang de bzhin te /
translated: The characteristics of the aggregate of form that arise from conceptualized discernment are also like that.

original: sngon gyi las kyi rgyu dang rkyen las skyes te nges pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyi rgyu dang rkyen las skyes te nges pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin no //
translated: It is not a definite nature, born from the causes and conditions of past karma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams de ltar yid la byed pa na gzugs la bdag gam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams de ltar yid la byed pa na gzugs la bdag gam /
translated: When bodhisattvas contemplate in this way, they do not grasp at form as a self or as

original: bdag gi bar mi len no //
analyzed: bdag gi bar mi len no //
translated: belonging to a self.

original: yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin du gzugs la rtog ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin du gzugs la rtog ste /
translated: They accurately contemplate form.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa phyin ci log tu rtog go /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa phyin ci log tu rtog go /
translated: They accurately contemplate the characteristic of impermanence and the inaccurate, mistaken [conceptions].

original: sems can dag ni phyin ci log gis bslad pas gzugs la bdag gzugs /
analyzed: sems can dag ni phyin ci log gis bslad pas gzugs la bdag gzugs /
translated: Sentient beings, deluded by mistaken [conceptions], cling to and grasp at form as a self,

original: bdag gi gzugs /
analyzed: bdag gi gzugs /
translated: as belonging to a self,

original: gzhan gzugs / gzhan gyi gzugs su zhen cing 'dzin to //
analyzed: gzhan gzugs / gzhan gyi gzugs su zhen cing 'dzin to //
translated: as another, or as belonging to another.

original: de ltar gzugs rnam par 'byed pa la rtog pa'i tshe gzugs su med dmigs /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs rnam par 'byed pa la rtog pa'i tshe gzugs su med dmigs /
translated: When contemplating in this way, distinguishing form, they do not observe form,

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin mi mthong /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin mi mthong /
translated: do not see the nature of form,

original: gzugs mi rtag pa la'ang mi chags so //
analyzed: gzugs mi rtag pa la'ang mi chags so //
translated: and are not attached to impermanent form.

original: byang chub sems dpas de'i tshe gzugs la chags pa dang / 'dzin pa thams cad bsal te med par gyur na gzugs kyi yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid la shin tu mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas de'i tshe gzugs la chags pa dang / 'dzin pa thams cad bsal te med par gyur na gzugs kyi yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid la shin tu mkhas pa yin /
translated: When the bodhisattvas at that time clear away and eliminate all attachment and grasping to form, they are skilled in the true characteristics of form.

original: gzugs mnyam pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa yin /
analyzed: gzugs mnyam pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa yin /
translated: They know the characteristic of the equality of form.

original: gzugs 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa @34a *//
analyzed: gzugs 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa @34a *//
translated: They know the characteristic of the cessation of form.

original: yin / gzugs 'gog pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa yin /🔽gzugs kyi phung po gang nas kyang ma 'ongs pa /
analyzed: yin / gzugs 'gog pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa yin / gzugs kyi phung po gang nas kyang ma 'ongs pa /
translated: They are skilled in the characteristic of the path that leads to the cessation of form.🔽They understand that the aggregate of form does not come from anywhere and does not go anywhere.

original: gang du'ang mi 'gro bar rab tu rtogs so; ;de ltar rtog pa'i tshe na lus dang / gzugs kyi phung po de las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par brtags pa las skyes te /
analyzed: gang du'ang mi 'gro bar rab tu rtogs so; ;de ltar rtog pa'i tshe na lus dang / gzugs kyi phung po de las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par brtags pa las skyes te /
translated: When they contemplate in this way, they understand that the body and the aggregate of form arise from the ripening of the results of karma and from conceptualization.

original: chen po bzhi 'dus pa las byung bar shes so //
analyzed: chen po bzhi 'dus pa las byung bar shes so //
translated: They understand that they arise from the combination of the four great elements.

original: lus kyi gzugs kyi phung po ni bdag ma yin /
analyzed: lus kyi gzugs kyi phung po ni bdag ma yin /
translated: The aggregate of form of the body is not the self,

original: gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin /
translated: it is not other,

original: bdag po med de /
analyzed: bdag po med de /
translated: it is not a master,

original: gang nas kyang ma 'ongs so //
analyzed: gang nas kyang ma 'ongs so //
translated: and it does not come from anywhere.

original: gzugs kyi phung po la de ltar rtog pa'i nang gi gzugs la mi chags mi len; phyi'i gzugs la mi chags mi len /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la de ltar rtog pa'i nang gi gzugs la mi chags mi len; phyi'i gzugs la mi chags mi len /
translated: In this way, they do not grasp at or cling to internal forms, nor do they grasp at or cling to external forms.

original: 'das pa'i gzugs la mi chags mi len /🔽ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mi chags mi len /
analyzed: 'das pa'i gzugs la mi chags mi len / ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mi chags mi len /
translated: They do not grasp at or cling to past forms,🔽nor do they grasp at or cling to future forms.

original: da lta'i gzugs la'ang mi chags mi len /
analyzed: da lta'i gzugs la'ang mi chags mi len /
translated: They do not grasp at or cling to present forms.

original: gzugs kyi phung po thams cad la ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid du shes so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po thams cad la ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid du shes so //
translated: They understand that all aggregates of form are characterized by non-arising.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe gzugs mi 'gag /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe gzugs mi 'gag /
translated: At that time, the bodhisattvas do not obstruct form.

original: gzugs 'gag pa'i chos tshol lo //
analyzed: gzugs 'gag pa'i chos tshol lo //
translated: They seek the Dharma of the cessation of form.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapāla,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams gzugs rnam par 'byed pa la rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams gzugs rnam par 'byed pa la rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas’ discernment of form.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapāla,

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams tshor ba nye bar len pa'i phung po rnam par 'byed pa la rtog pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams tshor ba nye bar len pa'i phung po rnam par 'byed pa la rtog pa yin zhe na /
translated: how do bodhisattva-mahāsattvas discern the aggregate of feeling that grasps?

original: byang chub sems dpas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The bodhisattvas think like this:

original: bde par tshor ba dang / sdug @34b bsngal du tshor ba dang / bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin par tshor ba 'di ni rten cing 'brel ba las byung ste /
analyzed: bde par tshor ba dang / sdug @34b bsngal du tshor ba dang / bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin par tshor ba 'di ni rten cing 'brel ba las byung ste /
translated: The feeling of pleasure, the feeling of pain, and the feeling that is neither pleasurable nor painful arise in dependence on causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang rkyen la rag lus bas tshor ba'i mtshan nyid la zhugs na /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen la rag lus bas tshor ba'i mtshan nyid la zhugs na /
translated: If one analyzes the characteristics of feeling,

original: de la tshor bar byed pa med de /
analyzed: de la tshor bar byed pa med de /
translated: one will not find any agent of feeling.

original: zhen pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: zhen pa tsam du zad do //
translated: It is merely a conceptual imputation.

original: zhen pa de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhen pa de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: That imputation is not real.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu btags pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu btags pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: It arises from unreal imagination.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de de snyam du sems pa na'ang 'di snyam du bus pa so so'i skye bo ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i tshor bas bcings nas tshor ba rnam pa gsum gyis rnam par gtses so //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de de snyam du sems pa na'ang 'di snyam du bus pa so so'i skye bo ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i tshor bas bcings nas tshor ba rnam pa gsum gyis rnam par gtses so //
translated: When the bodhisattva reflects in this way, he thinks: ‘The childish, ordinary beings are bound by unreal conceptualized feelings and are tormented by the three kinds of feelings.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Namely,

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba rnams so //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba rnams so //
translated: the feelings of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag gal te bde bar tshor ba na 'dod pa'i nyon mongs pas bkol te; 'dod pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phyir mi dge ba'i las rnam pa sna tshogs bskyed do //
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag gal te bde bar tshor ba na 'dod pa'i nyon mongs pas bkol te; 'dod pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phyir mi dge ba'i las rnam pa sna tshogs bskyed do //
translated: When childish ordinary beings feel pleasure, they are enslaved by the afflictive emotions of desire, and because of the secondary afflictions of desire, they give rise to various kinds of unwholesome actions.

original: gal te sdug bsngal du tshor ba na zhe sdang gi nyon mongs pas bkol te /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal du tshor ba na zhe sdang gi nyon mongs pas bkol te /
translated: When they feel pain, they are enslaved by the afflictive emotion of anger,

original: zhe sdang gi nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa'i phyir mi dge ba'i las rnam pa sna tshogs bskyed do //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa'i phyir mi dge ba'i las rnam pa sna tshogs bskyed do //
translated: and because of the secondary afflictions of anger, they give rise to various kinds of unwholesome actions.🔽When they feel neither pleasure nor pain, they are enslaved by the afflictive emotion of ignorance,

original: gal te bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin par tshor ba na ma rig pa'i nyon mongs pas bkol te; ma rig pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa'i phyir slos pa'i mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa las rnam par ma grol bar gyur to //
analyzed: gal te bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin par tshor ba na ma rig pa'i nyon mongs pas bkol te; ma rig pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa'i phyir slos pa'i mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa las rnam par ma grol bar gyur to //
translated: and because of the secondary afflictions of ignorance, they are not liberated from the suffering, lamentation, pain, sorrow, and despair.

original: bdag @35a *// gis bus pa so so'i skye bo'i rjes su bslab par mi bya yi /
analyzed: bdag @35a *// gis bus pa so so'i skye bo'i rjes su bslab par mi bya yi /
translated: I should not follow the example of childish ordinary beings.

original: chos rnams kyi yang dag pa nyid la brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi yang dag pa nyid la brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should investigate the reality of phenomena.

original: bdag cag gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin tshor ba la brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag cag gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin tshor ba la brtag par bya'o //
translated: We should investigate sensation as it really is.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin tshor ba'i phung po la brtags nas kyang 'di snyam du phung po ma yin pa ni tshor ba'i phung po ste rnam par brtag pa las skyes pa phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i tshor ba byed pa
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin tshor ba'i phung po la brtags nas kyang 'di snyam du phung po ma yin pa ni tshor ba'i phung po ste rnam par brtag pa las skyes pa phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i tshor ba byed pa
translated: When bodhisattvas investigate the aggregate of sensation as it really is, they think: The aggregate of sensation is not an aggregate, because it arises from conceptualization, and is associated with error.

original: med de / sngon gyi las kyi rgyu las skyes so //
analyzed: med de / sngon gyi las kyi rgyu las skyes so //
translated: Sensation is not produced by an agent, but arises from the causes of previous actions.

original: da ltar gyi rkyen gyis tshor ba rnams myong ste /
analyzed: da ltar gyi rkyen gyis tshor ba rnams myong ste /
translated: Sensation is experienced due to present conditions.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong bas tshor ba la tshor ba'i mtshan ma med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong bas tshor ba la tshor ba'i mtshan ma med do //
translated: Since it is empty by nature, sensation has no mark of sensation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams tshor ba'i phung po la rtog pa na chu'i chu bur lta bur skyes nas 'gags te nges par chad pa med par chud pa bzhin tshor ba'i phung po'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams tshor ba'i phung po la rtog pa na chu'i chu bur lta bur skyes nas 'gags te nges par chad pa med par chud pa bzhin tshor ba'i phung po'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: When bodhisattvas investigate the aggregate of feeling, they see that it is like a water bubble: it arises and ceases, and is not something that can be grasped.

original: rgyu dang / rkyen 'brel pa las skyes te rgyu dang / rkyen la rag las pas skad cig kyang mi gnas te /
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen 'brel pa las skyes te rgyu dang / rkyen la rag las pas skad cig kyang mi gnas te /
translated: The aggregate of feeling is like that, because it arises from the connection of causes and conditions, and because it is dependent on causes and conditions, it does not remain even for an instant.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pas rnam par brtags pa'i phyin ci log las skyes so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pas rnam par brtags pa'i phyin ci log las skyes so //
translated: It arises from the error of false imagination.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dag da'i tshe na'ang 'di snyam du bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni snying brtse ba'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dag da'i tshe na'ang 'di snyam du bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni snying brtse ba'i gnas yin no //
translated: At that time, bodhisattvas think, “Foolish ordinary beings are the objects of compassion.

original: tshor ba'i phung po la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi rtogs pas tshor ba rnams kyis nyon mongs par gyur to //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi rtogs pas tshor ba rnams kyis nyon mongs par gyur to //
translated: Because they do not understand the aggregate of feeling as it really is, they are afflicted by feelings.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba la'ang chags /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba la'ang chags /
translated: They are attached to feelings of pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la'ang chags /🔽bde ba'ang ma @35b yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la'ang chags /🔽bde ba'ang ma @35b yin /
translated: They are attached to feelings of pain.🔽They are attached to feelings that are neither pleasure nor pain.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la'ang chags pa skyed de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la'ang chags pa skyed de /
translated: One also generates attachment to feelings that are neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: tshor ba rnams kyis bcings pas 'khor ba na 'khor zhing lus gcig nas lus gcig tu rgyun mi 'chad de /
analyzed: tshor ba rnams kyis bcings pas 'khor ba na 'khor zhing lus gcig nas lus gcig tu rgyun mi 'chad de /
translated: Because one is bound by feelings, one cycles in saṃsāra and moves from one body to another without interruption.

original: tshor ba'i nyon mongs pas ni tshor ba'i phung po'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba'i nyon mongs pas ni tshor ba'i phung po'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is afflicted by feelings, one does not understand the characteristics of the aggregate of feeling as they are in reality.

original: bdag cag gis bus pa so so'i skye bo'i rjes su bslab par mi bya yi /
analyzed: bdag cag gis bus pa so so'i skye bo'i rjes su bslab par mi bya yi /
translated: We should not follow the example of childish ordinary beings.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin tshor ba'i phung po rnam par 'byed pa la brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin tshor ba'i phung po rnam par 'byed pa la brtag par bya'o //
translated: We should investigate the discernment of the aggregate of feeling as it is in reality.

original: de'i tshe yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin tshor ba'i phung po la rtog pa ni phung po med pa tshor ba'i phung po yin pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phung po de tshor ba'i phung po yin pa dang / phyin ci log gi phung po de tshor ba'i phung po yin pa dang /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin tshor ba'i phung po la rtog pa ni phung po med pa tshor ba'i phung po yin pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phung po de tshor ba'i phung po yin pa dang / phyin ci log gi phung po de tshor ba'i phung po yin pa dang /
translated: When one investigates the aggregate of feeling as it is in reality, one understands that the aggregate of feeling is a nonexistent aggregate, that that aggregate of feeling is an unreal aggregate, and that that aggregate of feeling is an inverted aggregate.

original: mi gnas pa'i phung po de tshor ba'i phung po yin par rtogs te /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i phung po de tshor ba'i phung po yin par rtogs te /
translated: The aggregates that do not endure are the aggregate of feeling.

original: de'i tshe na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshor ba'i phung po'i mtshan nyid mthong ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshor ba'i phung po'i mtshan nyid mthong ste /
translated: At that time, one sees the characteristics of the aggregate of feeling as they truly are.

original: byas pa med /
analyzed: byas pa med /
translated: It is not made.

original: byed pa med de /
analyzed: byed pa med de /
translated: It is not a maker.

original: tshor ba'i phung po la tshor ba'i phung po'i mtshan nyid kyang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po la tshor ba'i phung po'i mtshan nyid kyang mi mthong ngo //
translated: One does not see the characteristics of the aggregate of feeling in the aggregate of feeling.

original: de ltar tshor ba'i phung po la rtog pa na tshor ba'i phung po la nang na gnas par mi mthong /
analyzed: de ltar tshor ba'i phung po la rtog pa na tshor ba'i phung po la nang na gnas par mi mthong /
translated: When one investigates the aggregate of feeling in this way, one does not see the aggregate of feeling as existing internally,

original: tshor ba'i phung po la phyi rol na gnas par mi mthong ste /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po la phyi rol na gnas par mi mthong ste /
translated: nor does one see the aggregate of feeling as existing externally.

original: tshor ba bdag ces bya ba la mi chags /
analyzed: tshor ba bdag ces bya ba la mi chags /
translated: One is not attached to the idea that feeling is a self,

original: tshor ba bdag gi ba zhes bya ba la mi chags pas tshor ba'i phung po la gang nas kyang ma 'ongs la bdag po med de chos gang gis kyang ma bskyed par shes so //
analyzed: tshor ba bdag gi ba zhes bya ba la mi chags pas tshor ba'i phung po la gang nas kyang ma 'ongs la bdag po med de chos gang gis kyang ma bskyed par shes so //
translated: nor is one attached to the idea that feeling is a possession of a self. Thus, one understands that the aggregate of feeling does not come from anywhere, that it has no owner, and that it is not produced by any phenomenon.

original: tshor ba de ni phyin ci log dang @36a *//
analyzed: tshor ba de ni phyin ci log dang @36a *//
translated: That feeling is a distortion,

original: ldan pa dang / sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa las tshor ba'i phung po zhes rnam grang su btags par shes so //
analyzed: ldan pa dang / sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa las tshor ba'i phung po zhes rnam grang su btags par shes so //
translated: and that it is a designation for the ripening of the results of past karma.

original: tshor ba'i phung po la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rgyu dang / rkyen rgyun mi 'chad par spyod par mthong ste /🔽de'i dus na 'das pa'i tshor ba'i phung po la mi len /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rgyu dang / rkyen rgyun mi 'chad par spyod par mthong ste / de'i dus na 'das pa'i tshor ba'i phung po la mi len /
translated: He sees that the aggregate of sensation is the uninterrupted continuity of unreal causes and conditions.

original: mi chags / mi zhen /
analyzed: mi chags / mi zhen /
translated: At that time, he does not grasp, does not become attached to, and does not cling to the aggregate of sensation of the past.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i tshor ba'i phung po la'ang mi len; mi chags /🔽mi zhen / da ltar gyi tshor ba'i phung po la'ang mi len /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i tshor ba'i phung po la'ang mi len; mi chags / mi zhen / da ltar gyi tshor ba'i phung po la'ang mi len /
translated: He does not grasp, does not become attached to, and does not cling to the aggregate of sensation of the future.

original: mi chags / mi zhen te /
analyzed: mi chags / mi zhen te /
translated: He does not grasp, does not become attached to, and does not cling to the aggregate of sensation of the present.

original: gang zag des bde ba'i tshor ba las 'dod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa sel to //
analyzed: gang zag des bde ba'i tshor ba las 'dod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa sel to //
translated: That person eliminates the afflictions of desire from the sensation of pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba las zhe sdang ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa sel to //🔽bde ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba las zhe sdang ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa sel to //🔽bde ba'ang ma yin /
translated: He eliminates the afflictions of anger from the sensation of suffering.🔽He eliminates the afflictions of ignorance from the sensation that is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba las ma rig pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa sel bas brtson 'grus rab tu rtsom mo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba las ma rig pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa sel bas brtson 'grus rab tu rtsom mo //
translated: He exerts himself in his practice, because he has eliminated the defilement of ignorance with regard to the feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe gal te bde ba'i tshor ba myong ba na 'dod pa'i sems mi skye /🔽sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong ba zhen 'dod  pa'i  sems mi skye /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe gal te bde ba'i tshor ba myong ba na 'dod pa'i sems mi skye / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong ba zhen 'dod  pa'i  sems mi skye /
translated: “At that time, if the bodhisattva experiences a pleasant feeling, he does not give rise to a desirous mind.🔽If he experiences an unpleasant feeling, he does not give rise to an angry mind.

original: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba myong ba na gti mug gi sems mi skye'o //
analyzed: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba myong ba na gti mug gi sems mi skye'o //
translated: If he experiences a feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant, he does not give rise to a deluded mind.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokadhara,

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni phal cher ba dang  ba myong ba na 'dod pa skye'o //
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni phal cher ba dang  ba myong ba na 'dod pa skye'o //
translated: immature ordinary beings generally give rise to desire when they experience pleasant feelings,

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong ba na zhe sdang skye'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong ba na zhe sdang skye'o //
translated: give rise to anger when they experience unpleasant feelings,

original: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba myong ba na gti mug skye ste /
analyzed: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba myong ba na gti mug skye ste /
translated: and give rise to delusion when they experience feelings that are neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: de ltar bus pa  so so'i skye bo @36b dag ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi dbang gis ldongs par gyur pas tshor ba'i phung po la yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin mi shes /
analyzed: de ltar bus pa  so so'i skye bo @36b dag ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi dbang gis ldongs par gyur pas tshor ba'i phung po la yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin mi shes /
translated: Thus, ordinary childish beings, due to the power of desire, anger, and ignorance, become blind and do not understand the aggregate of sensation as it is in reality.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi mtshan nyid mi shes pas 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la bdag dang / bdag gi ba dang / 'di dang / gzhan du chags shing 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi mtshan nyid mi shes pas 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la bdag dang / bdag gi ba dang / 'di dang / gzhan du chags shing 'dzin to //
translated: Not understanding the characteristics of desire, anger, and ignorance, they become attached to desire, anger, and ignorance, grasping at self, mine, this, and that.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams tshor ba'i phung po 'di la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi dbang du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams tshor ba'i phung po 'di la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi dbang du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: bodhisattva mahāsattvas who accurately understand this aggregate of sensation will not fall under the power of desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: gal te 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug skyes na'ang de ma thag tu yongs su sel cing yang dag pa'i lam la nan tan byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug skyes na'ang de ma thag tu yongs su sel cing yang dag pa'i lam la nan tan byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If desire, hatred, or ignorance should arise, he immediately dispels them and applies himself to the path of right practice.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba myong ba las ni 'dod chags kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa bsal ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba myong ba las ni 'dod chags kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa bsal ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: From the experience of pleasant feeling, he applies himself to the practice of eliminating the defilement of desire.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong ba las ni zhe sdang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa bsal ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom mo //🔽bde ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong ba las ni zhe sdang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa bsal ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom mo // bde ba'ang ma yin /
translated: From the experience of painful feeling, he applies himself to the practice of eliminating the defilement of hatred.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba myong ba las ni gti mug gi kun nas nyon mongs pa bsal ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba myong ba las ni gti mug gi kun nas nyon mongs pa bsal ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
translated: From the experience of neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling, he applies himself to the practice of eliminating the defilement of ignorance.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshor ba rnam pa gsum shes par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshor ba rnam pa gsum shes par byed do //
translated: He knows the three kinds of feeling as they really are.

original: de'i tshe na ji tsam du tshor bar 'gyur ba gal te bde bar tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal bar tshor ba dang / bde ba'ang ma @37a *//
analyzed: de'i tshe na ji tsam du tshor bar 'gyur ba gal te bde bar tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal bar tshor ba dang / bde ba'ang ma @37a *//
translated: At that time, to whatever extent there is feeling, if it is pleasant feeling, painful feeling, or neither pleasant nor painful feeling,

original: yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba kun la'ang mi chags te /
analyzed: yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba kun la'ang mi chags te /
translated: At that time, to whatever extent there is feeling, whether it is pleasant, painful, or neither pleasant nor painful, one is not attached to any of them.

original: ring du gyur na'ang 'dod chags kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ring du gyur na'ang 'dod chags kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur /
translated: Even if they are prolonged, one is free from the afflictive emotions of desire,

original: zhe sdang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur /
translated: free from the afflictive emotions of anger,

original: gti mug gi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gti mug gi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: and free from the afflictive emotions of delusion.

original: tshor ba 'byung ba'i dus na tshor ba'i phung po la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi rtag pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong zhing shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba 'byung ba'i dus na tshor ba'i phung po la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi rtag pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong zhing shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: When feelings arise, one sees and understands the aggregate of feeling as it truly is, impermanent,

original: gal te de ltar shes nas tshor ba'i phung po la 'dod pa'i chags pa yongs su gcod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar shes nas tshor ba'i phung po la 'dod pa'i chags pa yongs su gcod par 'gyur te /
translated: and if one understands it in this way, the attachment of desire toward the aggregate of feeling will be eliminated.

original: yongs su gcod pa'i tshor ba'i phung po la zhugs pas 'dod cing chags pa'i lam dag tu tshor ba rnams kyis nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa'i tshor ba'i phung po la zhugs pas 'dod cing chags pa'i lam dag tu tshor ba rnams kyis nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By penetrating the aggregate of sensation, they will not be afflicted by the sensations of the paths of desire and attachment.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gal te de ltar yang dag pa ji lta bar zhin tshor ba'i phung po rtogs shing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin tshor ba'i phung po shes nas tshor ba'i phung po'i kun 'byung dang / tshor ba'i phung po'i 'gog pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gal te de ltar yang dag pa ji lta bar zhin tshor ba'i phung po rtogs shing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin tshor ba'i phung po shes nas tshor ba'i phung po'i kun 'byung dang / tshor ba'i phung po'i 'gog pa dang /
translated: Thus, if bodhisattvas realize the aggregate of sensation as it truly is, and if they understand the aggregate of sensation as it truly is, they will fully understand the origin of the aggregate of sensation, the cessation of the aggregate of sensation,

original: tshor ba'i phung po'i 'gog pa'i lam yongs su shes par 'gyur ro //🔽de nas tshor ba'i phung pos ma skyes pa la mtshan nyid du shes /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po'i 'gog pa'i lam yongs su shes par 'gyur ro // de nas tshor ba'i phung pos ma skyes pa la mtshan nyid du shes /
translated: and the path to the cessation of the aggregate of sensation.🔽Then, they will understand the aggregate of sensation as unborn.

original: ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis tshor ba'i phung po la mtshan ma med pa khong du chud cing rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis tshor ba'i phung po la mtshan ma med pa khong du chud cing rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the characteristic of the unborn, they will understand and realize that the aggregate of sensation is signless.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokadhara,

original: 'di @37b dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams tshor ba'i phung po rnam par 'byed pa la rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di @37b dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams tshor ba'i phung po rnam par 'byed pa la rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas’ discernment of the aggregate of feeling.”

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokaprajña,

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'du shes kyi phung po rnam par 'byed pa la rtog ce na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'du shes kyi phung po rnam par 'byed pa la rtog ce na /
translated: how do bodhisattva-mahāsattvas discern the aggregate of perception?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin 'du shes kyi phung po la rtog pa'i tshe 'du shes kyi phung po de phyin ci log las skyes te yang dag pa ma yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin 'du shes kyi phung po la rtog pa'i tshe 'du shes kyi phung po de phyin ci log las skyes te yang dag pa ma yin /
translated: When bodhisattva-mahāsattvas contemplate the aggregate of perception as it truly is, they see that the aggregate of perception arises from error and is not real.

original: snying po med pa /
analyzed: snying po med pa /
translated: It is without essence,

original: mi brtan pa /
analyzed: mi brtan pa /
translated: unstable,

original: thog ma nas ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: thog ma nas ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: and characterized by being unborn from the beginning.

original: chad pas rgyu dang / rkyen 'dus pa dang / sngon gyi las kyi mthu las byung ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: chad pas rgyu dang / rkyen 'dus pa dang / sngon gyi las kyi mthu las byung ba mthong ngo //
translated: It arises from the power of the accumulation of causes and conditions and past karma.

original: yang 'di snyam du phung po ma yin pa ni 'du shes kyi phung pos te /
analyzed: yang 'di snyam du phung po ma yin pa ni 'du shes kyi phung pos te /
translated: They also think, ‘The aggregate of perception is not an aggregate.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phung po ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //🔽phyin ci log gi phung po ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phung po ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o // phyin ci log gi phung po ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
translated: The aggregate of false perception is the aggregate of perception.🔽The aggregate of distorted perception is the aggregate of perception.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po la 'du shes kyi phung po'i mtshan ma med pa ni /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po la 'du shes kyi phung po'i mtshan ma med pa ni /
translated: The aggregate of perception has no characteristics of the aggregate of perception.

original: dper na / dbyar gyi smig rgyu ba lta bu ming tsam ste /
analyzed: dper na / dbyar gyi smig rgyu ba lta bu ming tsam ste /
translated: It is merely a name, like a mirage in the summer.

original: smig rgyu ba'i phung po dang 'dra bar 'du shes kyi phung po 'di'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: smig rgyu ba'i phung po dang 'dra bar 'du shes kyi phung po 'di'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as a mirage is a mass of air, so too is this aggregate of perception.

original: rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes kyis 'du shes zhes btags so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes kyis 'du shes zhes btags so //
translated: It is designated as perception by the perception of consciousness.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo ni yang dag pa ma yin pa 'du shes 'dis bcings te /
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo ni yang dag pa ma yin pa 'du shes 'dis bcings te /
translated: Childish ordinary beings are bound by this false perception.

original: bde bar rnam par shes /
analyzed: bde bar rnam par shes /
translated: They perceive happiness.

original: sdug bsngal du rnam par shes /🔽bde ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal du rnam par shes / bde ba'ang ma yin /
translated: They perceive suffering.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin par rnam par shes /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin par rnam par shes /
translated: They perceive what is neither happiness nor suffering.

original: grang ba dang / tsha bar rnam par shes /🔽skyes pa dang @38a *//
analyzed: grang ba dang / tsha bar rnam par shes / skyes pa dang @38a *//
translated: They perceive heat and cold.

original: bud med du rnam par shes /
analyzed: bud med du rnam par shes /
translated: They perceive male and female.

original: lam rgyud lngar 'khor bar rnam par shes /
analyzed: lam rgyud lngar 'khor bar rnam par shes /
translated: They perceive the five classes of beings cycling in saṃsāra.

original: 'dus par rnam par shes /
analyzed: 'dus par rnam par shes /
translated: They are conscious of being assembled.

original: gyes par rnam par shes /🔽'das par rnam par shes /🔽ma 'ongs par rnam par shes /
analyzed: gyes par rnam par shes / 'das par rnam par shes / ma 'ongs par rnam par shes /
translated: They are conscious of being dispersed.🔽They are conscious of the past.🔽They are conscious of the future.

original: da ltar gyir rnam par shes /
analyzed: da ltar gyir rnam par shes /
translated: They are conscious of the present.

original: bzang por rnam par shes /
analyzed: bzang por rnam par shes /
translated: They are conscious of the good.

original: ngan par rnam par shes /🔽yod par rnam par shes /
analyzed: ngan par rnam par shes / yod par rnam par shes /
translated: They are conscious of the bad.🔽They are conscious of existence.

original: med par rnam par shes so //
analyzed: med par rnam par shes so //
translated: They are conscious of nonexistence.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo 'du shes ni phyin ci log yang dag pa ma yin pa'i dbang du gyur pas rgyu dang / rkyen la rag lus te 'du shes kyi phung po zhes btags pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo 'du shes ni phyin ci log yang dag pa ma yin pa'i dbang du gyur pas rgyu dang / rkyen la rag lus te 'du shes kyi phung po zhes btags pa tsam du zad do //
translated: The perception of childish ordinary beings is distorted and unreal. It is dependent on causes and conditions, and is merely designated as the aggregate of perception.

original: de la ni nang ngam; phyi rol na 'du shes zhes bya ba med de bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i 'du shes kyis bcings pas 'dod chags su rnam par shes /
analyzed: de la ni nang ngam; phyi rol na 'du shes zhes bya ba med de bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i 'du shes kyis bcings pas 'dod chags su rnam par shes /
translated: In this regard, there is no such thing as perception, whether internal or external. Childish ordinary beings are bound by unreal perception, and so they are conscious of desire,

original: zhe sdang du rnam par shes /
analyzed: zhe sdang du rnam par shes /
translated: they are conscious of anger,

original: gti mug tu rnam par shes /
analyzed: gti mug tu rnam par shes /
translated: they are conscious of delusion,

original: bu dang / chung mar rnam par shes so //
analyzed: bu dang / chung mar rnam par shes so //
translated: they are conscious of sons and wives.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni 'du shes kyi phung po la gnas te yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lam la chags pas 'du shes kyi phung pos 'khor ba na 'khor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni 'du shes kyi phung po la gnas te yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lam la chags pas 'du shes kyi phung pos 'khor ba na 'khor bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Childish ordinary beings abide in the aggregate of perception. Attached to the unreal path, they circle in saṃsāra due to the aggregate of perception.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes kyi phung po yang dag pa ma yin par mi rtogs so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes kyi phung po yang dag pa ma yin par mi rtogs so //
translated: They do not realize that the aggregate of perception is unreal, just as it is.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni bdag tu 'du shes; pha rol por 'du shes so //
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni bdag tu 'du shes; pha rol por 'du shes so //
translated: Childish ordinary beings have the perception of self and the perception of other.

original: skyes pa dang / bud med du 'du shes te 'du shes kyi phung pos bcings pas rnam par ma grol te /
analyzed: skyes pa dang / bud med du 'du shes te 'du shes kyi phung pos bcings pas rnam par ma grol te /
translated: They have the perception of male and female. Bound by the aggregate of perception, they are not liberated.

original: bdag 'du shes kyi phung po yin pa dang / bdag gi @38b ba 'du shes kyi phung po yin par chags shing 'dzin to //
analyzed: bdag 'du shes kyi phung po yin pa dang / bdag gi @38b ba 'du shes kyi phung po yin par chags shing 'dzin to //
translated: They are attached to and grasp at the thought ‘The aggregate of perception is me’ and ‘The aggregate of perception is mine.’

original: bdag cag ni bus pa so so'i skye bo'i rjes su bslab par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag cag ni bus pa so so'i skye bo'i rjes su bslab par mi bya'o //
translated: We should not train like childish ordinary beings.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams de ltar yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes kyi phung po la rtog pa na 'du shes kyi phung po de la 'du shes kyi phung por mi dmigs pa na smig rgyu ba'i phung po la smig
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams de ltar yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes kyi phung po la rtog pa na 'du shes kyi phung po de la 'du shes kyi phung por mi dmigs pa na smig rgyu ba'i phung po la smig
translated: When bodhisattva great beings thus correctly contemplate the aggregate of perception, they do not observe the aggregate of perception as the aggregate of perception, just as a mirage is not observed as a mirage.

original: rgyu ba'i phung por mi dmigs pa bzhin no; ;byang chub sems dpa'i 'du shes kyi phung po la smig rgyu ba nyid mthong bas 'das pa'i 'du shes kyi phung po la mi chags /
analyzed: rgyu ba'i phung por mi dmigs pa bzhin no; ;byang chub sems dpa'i 'du shes kyi phung po la smig rgyu ba nyid mthong bas 'das pa'i 'du shes kyi phung po la mi chags /
translated: Because bodhisattvas see the aggregate of perception as a mirage, they do not become attached to the past aggregate of perception,

original: mi len / mi zhen /
analyzed: mi len / mi zhen /
translated: do not take it up, and do not cling to it.

original: ma 'ongs pas 'du shes kyi phung po la mi chags /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pas 'du shes kyi phung po la mi chags /
translated: They do not become attached to the future aggregate of perception,

original: mi len / mi zhen /
analyzed: mi len / mi zhen /
translated: do not take it up, and do not cling to it.

original: da ltar gyi 'du shes kyi phung po la mi gnas /
analyzed: da ltar gyi 'du shes kyi phung po la mi gnas /
translated: They do not abide in the present aggregate of perception,

original: bdag dang / gzhan du rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: bdag dang / gzhan du rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: and they do not conceptualize it as self or other.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po 'gog pa la nan tan byed cing 'du shes kyi phung po'i lam ma skyes par khong du chud do //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po 'gog pa la nan tan byed cing 'du shes kyi phung po'i lam ma skyes par khong du chud do //
translated: They practice the cessation of the aggregate of perception and understand the path of the aggregate of perception to be unborn.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po la ma 'ongs pa'i gnas dang / song ba'i gnas yod par mi mthong ste /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po la ma 'ongs pa'i gnas dang / song ba'i gnas yod par mi mthong ste /
translated: In the aggregate of conceptualization, one does not see a place of future dwelling or a place of past dwelling.

original: phyin ci log dang ldan pa dang / sngon gyi las kyi rgyu las skyes te /
analyzed: phyin ci log dang ldan pa dang / sngon gyi las kyi rgyu las skyes te /
translated: It is endowed with error and arises from the cause of past karma.

original: da ltar gyi rkyen gyis rnam par bcings so //
analyzed: da ltar gyi rkyen gyis rnam par bcings so //
translated: It is bound by present conditions.

original: phung po med pa ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: phung po med pa ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
translated: The non-aggregate is the aggregate of conceptualization.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po la 'ongs pa'i gnas kyang med /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po la 'ongs pa'i gnas kyang med /
translated: In the aggregate of conceptualization, there is no place of coming and no place of going.

original: song ba'i gnas kyang med par 'byed cing rtog na 'du shes kyi phung po ma skyes par khong du chud do //🔽'du shes kyi phung po dgag par rnam par mi rtog pa ni 'du shes kyi tshor ba thams cad dgag pa'i phyir yang dag pa ji lta @39a *//
analyzed: song ba'i gnas kyang med par 'byed cing rtog na 'du shes kyi phung po ma skyes par khong du chud do // 'du shes kyi phung po dgag par rnam par mi rtog pa ni 'du shes kyi tshor ba thams cad dgag pa'i phyir yang dag pa ji lta @39a *//
translated: If one analyzes and understands this, one comprehends the non-arising of the aggregate of conceptualization.

original: ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-discrimination of the cessation of the aggregate of conceptualization is because all conceptual sensations are stopped, and one abides in the knowledge and vision of reality just as it is.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes kyi phung po la rtog pa'i tshe 'du shes kyi phung po dang bral te 'du shes kyi lam la mi gnas pa 'du shes kyi phung po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes🔽shing mthong ba la gnas pa dang / 'du shes kyi phung po la mi chags par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes kyi phung po thams cad rnam par 'byed cing rtog pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes kyi phung po'i kun 'byung dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes kyi phung po la rtog pa'i tshe 'du shes kyi phung po dang bral te 'du shes kyi lam la mi gnas pa 'du shes kyi phung po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing mthong ba la gnas pa dang / 'du shes kyi phung po la mi chags par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes kyi phung po thams cad rnam par 'byed cing rtog pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes kyi phung po'i kun 'byung dang /
translated: When bodhisattvas investigate the aggregate of perception in accordance with reality, they are free from the aggregate of perception and do not abide on the path of perception. They abide in the knowledge and seeing of the aggregate of perception in accordance with reality,🔽and without attachment to the aggregate of perception, they correctly discern and investigate all the aggregates of perception in accordance with reality, and they know the origin,

original: 'gog pa dang / zad pa shes so //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang / zad pa shes so //
translated: cessation, and exhaustion of the aggregate of perception in accordance with reality.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapāla,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'du shes kyi phung po rnam par 'byed pa rtog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'du shes kyi phung po rnam par 'byed pa rtog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: thus bodhisattva-mahāsattvas are said to discern and investigate the aggregate of perception.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po la chags pa dang bral bas 'du shes kyi phung po la chags pa gcod pa'i lam la nan tan byed par 'gyur ro ////
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po la chags pa dang bral bas 'du shes kyi phung po la chags pa gcod pa'i lam la nan tan byed par 'gyur ro ////
translated: They will be free from attachment to the aggregate of perception, and will diligently practice the path that severs attachment to the aggregate of perception.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin ces bya ba'i mdo /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin ces bya ba'i mdo /
translated: The Sūtra on the World

original: bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: bam po gnyis pa /
translated: Scroll Two

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'du byed kyi phung po rnam par 'byed pa la rtog ce na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'du byed kyi phung po rnam par 'byed pa la rtog ce na /
translated: how do bodhisattva mahāsattvas contemplate the discernment of the aggregate of formation?

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'du byed kyi phung po 'di ni phyin ci log las skyes te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'du byed kyi phung po 'di ni phyin ci log las skyes te /
translated: the aggregate of formation of bodhisattva mahāsattvas arises from error.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu brtags pa las brtags pa tsam du yod pas brtags so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu brtags pa las brtags pa tsam du yod pas brtags so //
translated: Since it is merely imputed from false imagination, it is imputed.

original: byang chub @39b sems dpa' de'i tshe lus kyis 'du byed pa dang / ngag gis 'du byed pa dang / yid kyis 'du byed pa dang / kun la mi gtsang ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa nyid dang; bdag med par rtog go /
analyzed: byang chub @39b sems dpa' de'i tshe lus kyis 'du byed pa dang / ngag gis 'du byed pa dang / yid kyis 'du byed pa dang / kun la mi gtsang ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa nyid dang; bdag med par rtog go /
translated: At that time, the bodhisattva will contemplate the body, speech, and mind as impure, impermanent, painful, empty, and selfless.

original: de ltar rtog pa'i tshe 'di snyam du phung po ma yin pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa'i tshe 'di snyam du phung po ma yin pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
translated: When contemplating in this way, he will think, ‘The aggregate of mental formations is not a real aggregate.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
translated: The aggregate of mental formations is an aggregate of suffering.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i phung po ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i phung po ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
translated: The aggregate of mental formations is an aggregate of dependent origination.

original: gzugs brnyan gyi phung po ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi phung po ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
translated: The aggregate of mental formations is an aggregate of reflections.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po ni mi 'phel ba /🔽mi bri ba /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po ni mi 'phel ba / mi bri ba /
translated: The aggregate of mental formations is neither increasing nor decreasing.

original: ma bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: ma bsdus pa'o //
translated: It is neither collected nor scattered.

original: lus kyis 'du byed pa dang / ngag gis 'du byed pa dang / yid kyis 'du byed pa byas pa med de /
analyzed: lus kyis 'du byed pa dang / ngag gis 'du byed pa dang / yid kyis 'du byed pa byas pa med de /

original: mkhas pa dag ni 'du byed kyi phung po de la mi chags /
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni 'du byed kyi phung po de la mi chags /
translated: The wise are not attached to the aggregate of formation.

original: mi len to //
analyzed: mi len to //
translated: The wise do not cling to or grasp at the aggregate of formation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: lus kyis 'du byed pa rnams lus kyi nang na mi gnas /
analyzed: lus kyis 'du byed pa rnams lus kyi nang na mi gnas /
translated: The formations of the body do not exist inside the body,

original: lus kyi phyi rol na mi gnas /
analyzed: lus kyi phyi rol na mi gnas /
translated: nor do they exist outside the body,

original: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas so //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas so //
translated: nor do they exist somewhere in between.

original: ngag gis 'du byed pa dang / yid kyis 'du byed pa'ang de bzhin du nang na mi gnas /
analyzed: ngag gis 'du byed pa dang / yid kyis 'du byed pa'ang de bzhin du nang na mi gnas /
translated: The formations of speech and the formations of the mind do not exist inside,

original: phyi rol na mi gnas /
analyzed: phyi rol na mi gnas /
translated: nor do they exist outside,

original: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas te /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas te /
translated: nor do they exist somewhere in between.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po la 'du byed kyi phung po'i mtshan ma med do //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po la 'du byed kyi phung po'i mtshan ma med do //
translated: The aggregate of formation has no characteristics of the aggregate of formation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'du byed kyi phung po de ni rgyu dang / rkyen mang po dang / phyin ci log dang / yang dag par ma yin pa dang / sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa las skyes te /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po de ni rgyu dang / rkyen mang po dang / phyin ci log dang / yang dag par ma yin pa dang / sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa las skyes te /
translated: The aggregate of formation arises from many causes and conditions, from error, from what is not real, and from the ripening of the results of past actions.

original: rgyu dang / rkyen gyis gzung bas na 'du byed rnams byas par gyur to //
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen gyis gzung bas na 'du byed rnams byas par gyur to //
translated: Since it is grasped by causes and conditions, formations are created.

original: lus kyis @40a *//
analyzed: lus kyis @40a *//
translated: The formations of the body

analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid la ma nges pas lus kyis 'du byed pa dang / ngag gis 'du byed pa dang / yid kyis 'du byed pa dag gnas 'di na 'am / gnas gzhan na 'am /

analyzed: nang ngam / phyi rol na gnas par ma nges pa'i phyir ro // lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis 'du byed pa'ang 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid du nges pa med / dmigs su med /

original: brjod du med na /
analyzed: brjod du med na /
translated: They are not real, and so they do not create anything.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po dmigs su yod pa 'am /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po dmigs su yod pa 'am /
translated: They are

original: brjod du yod pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: brjod du yod pa lta ci smos te /
translated: how much less could it be expressed in words!

original: de bas na phung po med pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na phung po med pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the absence of the aggregates is called the aggregate of mental formations.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni phyin ci log tu 'du shes bskyed nas lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi 'du byed pa la chags te /
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni phyin ci log tu 'du shes bskyed nas lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi 'du byed pa la chags te /
translated: Childish ordinary beings, having generated distorted perceptions, are attached to the formations of body, speech, and mind.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po la rnam par rtog pas 'du byed kyi phung pos bcings te 'khor ba na 'khor bar gyur to //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po la rnam par rtog pas 'du byed kyi phung pos bcings te 'khor ba na 'khor bar gyur to //
translated: Due to conceptualizing the aggregate of mental formations, they are bound by the aggregate of mental formations and revolve in saṃsāra.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag phyin ci log gi dbang du gyur pas lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi 'du byed skyed de /
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag phyin ci log gi dbang du gyur pas lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi 'du byed skyed de /
translated: Childish ordinary beings, under the influence of distortion, generate the formations of body, speech, and mind.

original: de la 'dzin cing chags pas chos ma yin pa la chos su 'du shes /
analyzed: de la 'dzin cing chags pas chos ma yin pa la chos su 'du shes /
translated: Grasping and being attached to that, they perceive non-Dharma as Dharma.

original: phung po @40b med pa la phung por shes so //
analyzed: phung po @40b med pa la phung por shes so //
translated: They perceive the absence of aggregates as aggregates.

original: phyin ci log gi 'du byed la chags pa des rnam par bcings te lam rgyud lngar 'khor zhing rtag tu lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi 'du byed kyi rjes su spyod de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi rtogs /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi 'du byed la chags pa des rnam par bcings te lam rgyud lngar 'khor zhing rtag tu lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi 'du byed kyi rjes su spyod de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi rtogs /
translated: Bound by attachment to the formations of error, they revolve in the five destinies and always follow the formations of body, speech, and mind, not realizing the truth of suchness.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'du byed kyi phung po ma rtogs pas lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi sgo nas 'du byed rnams bskyed par gyur to //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'du byed kyi phung po ma rtogs pas lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi sgo nas 'du byed rnams bskyed par gyur to //
translated: Not realizing the aggregate of formations in accordance with the truth, they give rise to formations through body, speech, and mind.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag phyin ci log la chags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag phyin ci log la chags pa'i phyir /
translated: Because childish ordinary beings are attached to error,

original: de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i chos la chags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i chos la chags pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are attached to phenomena that are not reality,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa la chags pa'i phyir 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa la chags pa'i phyir 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: and because they are attached to what is not true, it is called the aggregate of formations.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'di la de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtags na 'du byed rnams kyi dngos po med de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'di la de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtags na 'du byed rnams kyi dngos po med de /
translated: when bodhisattvas examine this in accordance with the truth, they see that formations have no substance.

original: rab tu mthu chung brgyu dang / rkyen mang po 'dus pa las 'du byed kyi phung po zhes brjod cing btags te /
analyzed: rab tu mthu chung brgyu dang / rkyen mang po 'dus pa las 'du byed kyi phung po zhes brjod cing btags te /
translated: It is said to be the aggregate of formation because of the coming together of many weak causes and conditions.

original: de la yang dag par 'du byed kyi phung po med par rtogs so //
analyzed: de la yang dag par 'du byed kyi phung po med par rtogs so //
translated: It is understood that the aggregate of formation does not exist.

original: phung po med pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: phung po med pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
translated: The nonexistence of the aggregates is the aggregate of formation.

original: thog ma nas ma skyes pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: thog ma nas ma skyes pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
translated: Not arising from the beginning is the aggregate of formation.

original: rang bzhin med pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //🔽'du byed rnams snga ma'i mtha' yang dmigs su med /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o // 'du byed rnams snga ma'i mtha' yang dmigs su med /
