translated: needless to say they are unable to contemplate the subtle characteristics of the arising and cessation of the five appropriated aggregates.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'ang mi shes /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'ang mi shes /
translated: Why is this?🔽It is because ordinary foolish beings do not understand the five appropriated aggregates,

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i bden pa'ang mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i bden pa'ang mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and they do not understand the truth of the five appropriated aggregates.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni nye bar len pa'ang mi shes /
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni nye bar len pa'ang mi shes /
translated: Ordinary foolish people do not understand appropriation,

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'ang mi shes so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'ang mi shes so //
translated: nor do they understand the five appropriated aggregates.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: 'di ji ltar na nye bar len pa zhes bya zhe na /🔽nye bar len pa ni bdag tu nye bar len /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar na nye bar len pa zhes bya zhe na / nye bar len pa ni bdag tu nye bar len /
translated: why is it called appropriation?

original: sems can du nye bar len /
analyzed: sems can du nye bar len /
translated: It is called appropriation because it appropriates a self, appropriates sentient beings,

original: lta bar nye bar len /
analyzed: lta bar nye bar len /
translated: appropriates views,

original: tshul khrims nye bar len /
analyzed: tshul khrims nye bar len /
translated: appropriates morality,

original: phung po lnga nye bar len /
analyzed: phung po lnga nye bar len /
translated: appropriates the five aggregates,

original: khams bco brgyad nye bar len /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad nye bar len /
translated: appropriates the eighteen elements,

original: rgyu rkyen bcu gnyis nye bar len pas na nye bar len pa zhes bya'o //🔽ji tsam du chos su gdags pa phyi 'am /
analyzed: rgyu rkyen bcu gnyis nye bar len pas na nye bar len pa zhes bya'o // ji tsam du chos su gdags pa phyi 'am /
translated: and appropriates the twelve causes and conditions.

original: nang gi 'dod pa nye bar len pa dang / @50b srid pa nye bar len pa dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / tshor ba dang / shes pa nye bar len /
analyzed: nang gi 'dod pa nye bar len pa dang / @50b srid pa nye bar len pa dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / tshor ba dang / shes pa nye bar len /
translated: To the extent that phenomena are designated, whether externally or internally, they are appropriated: the appropriation of desire, the appropriation of existence, the appropriation of what is seen, heard, felt, and cognized,

original: bdag dang / bdag gi bar nye bar len to //
analyzed: bdag dang / bdag gi bar nye bar len to //
translated: and the appropriation of self and what belongs to self.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo yang dag pa ma yin pa'i nye bar len pa'i 'di la mi shes mi mthong ste /
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo yang dag pa ma yin pa'i nye bar len pa'i 'di la mi shes mi mthong ste /
translated: Ordinary foolish people do not know or see this false appropriation.

original: phyin ci log gi rgyu dang / rkyen gyis chos su nye bar len to //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rgyu dang / rkyen gyis chos su nye bar len to //
translated: They appropriate dharmas through causes and conditions that are mistaken.

original: gang zag de nye bar len pas rnam par bcings pas ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed nye bar len /
analyzed: gang zag de nye bar len pas rnam par bcings pas ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed nye bar len /
translated: Because those people are bound by appropriation, they appropriate formations through the condition of ignorance.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa nye bar len /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa nye bar len /
translated: They appropriate consciousness through the condition of formations.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang / gzugs nye bar len /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang / gzugs nye bar len /
translated: They appropriate name-and-form through the condition of consciousness.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi mtshan ma sbom po la sems can rnams chags shing zhen te nye bar len to //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi mtshan ma sbom po la sems can rnams chags shing zhen te nye bar len to //
translated: Sentient beings are attached to and cling to the coarse characteristics of name-and-form and appropriate them.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: gzugs len / gzugs dang 'byor /
analyzed: gzugs len / gzugs dang 'byor /
translated: They appropriate form, are endowed with form,

original: gzugs kyis bcings so //
analyzed: gzugs kyis bcings so //
translated: and are bound by form.

original: gzhan yang / gzugs med pa'i phung po bzhi nye bar len te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / gzugs med pa'i phung po bzhi nye bar len te /
translated: Moreover, they appropriate the four formless aggregates.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes par rnam par rtog cing ming du btags so //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes par rnam par rtog cing ming du btags so //
translated: They conceptualize and give names to feelings, perceptions, formations, and consciousness.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokadhara,

original: gal te sangs rgyas med na sems can rnams shes pa med /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas med na sems can rnams shes pa med /
translated: If there were no buddhas, there would be no sentient beings.🔽

original: mthong ba med pas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtog mi nus so //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du gshegs nas sems can gzugs la rten cing gnas pa gzhig pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la rten cing gnas pa gzhig pa dang / bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid gzhig @51a *//
analyzed: mthong ba med pas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtog mi nus so // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du gshegs nas sems can gzugs la rten cing gnas pa gzhig pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la rten cing gnas pa gzhig pa dang / bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid gzhig @51a *//
translated: If there were no Buddha, sentient beings would be without knowledge and without vision, and so would be unable to understand the five appropriated aggregates as they are.

original: pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de ltar rnam par phye ste bstan to //
analyzed: pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de ltar rnam par phye ste bstan to //
translated: The Blessed Buddha, having come into the world, taught in order to destroy the sentient beings’ reliance on and attachment to form, and in order to destroy their reliance on and attachment to feeling, notion, co-producing factors, and consciousness, and in order to destroy their reliance on and attachment to the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: khyed rnams kyis rten cing gnas pa ni gzugs yin no //
analyzed: khyed rnams kyis rten cing gnas pa ni gzugs yin no //
translated: “You should know that reliance and attachment are form.

original: gzugs de ni chen po bzhi 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs de ni chen po bzhi 'dus pa ste /
translated: Form is the combination of the four great elements.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni ming tsam ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni ming tsam ste /
translated: Feeling, notion, co-producing factors, and consciousness are mere names.

original: ming dang / gzugs kyi mtshan ma bsgrub pa'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga bshad do //
analyzed: ming dang / gzugs kyi mtshan ma bsgrub pa'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga bshad do //
translated: In order to establish the characteristics of name and form, the five appropriated aggregates are explained.

original: khyod so so'i skye bo rnams kyis mi brtan pa'i snying po med pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga 'di la mi gnas mi chags par bya'o //
analyzed: khyod so so'i skye bo rnams kyis mi brtan pa'i snying po med pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga 'di la mi gnas mi chags par bya'o //
translated: You should not dwell on or be attached to these five appropriated aggregates, which are unstable and insubstantial, and which are not the domain of ordinary beings.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapālas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ci'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po bshad ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ci'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po bshad ce na /
translated: why did the Tathāgata explain the appropriated aggregates?

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapālas,

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag phyin ci log las skyes te /
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag phyin ci log las skyes te /
translated: childish ordinary beings arise from error,

original: ma rig pa'i dra bas glags pas 'khor ba na 'khor bar gyur to //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i dra bas glags pas 'khor ba na 'khor bar gyur to //
translated: and because they are caught in the net of ignorance, they revolve in saṃsāra.

original: cis 'khor zhe na /
analyzed: cis 'khor zhe na /
translated: What causes them to revolve?

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan ma la chags shing 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan ma la chags shing 'dzin pas so //
translated: They are attached to and grasp at the characteristics of the five appropriated aggregates.

original: 'di snyam du bdag 'di la gnas pas bde bar gyur to snyam sems te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du bdag 'di la gnas pas bde bar gyur to snyam sems te /
translated: They think, ‘I will dwell on this and be happy.’

original: gang zag de bde ba'i mtshan mar bzung bas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la chags shing gnas so //
analyzed: gang zag de bde ba'i mtshan mar bzung bas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la chags shing gnas so //
translated: Because they grasp at the signs of happiness, they are attached to and dwell in the five appropriated aggregates.

original: sdug bsngal gyi mtshan ma dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi mtshan ma dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: They grasp at the signs of suffering,

original: bde ba'ang ma yin pa'i mtshan mar bzung zhing chags pas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas shing chags so //
analyzed: bde ba'ang ma yin pa'i mtshan mar bzung zhing chags pas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas shing chags so //
translated: and because they are attached to the signs of neither suffering nor happiness, they dwell in and are attached to the five appropriated aggregates.

original: bus pa so so skye bo dag brten pa'i gnas ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga yin no //
analyzed: bus pa so so skye bo dag brten pa'i gnas ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga yin no //
translated: The five appropriated aggregates are the basis of support for childish ordinary beings.

original: 'jig rten @51b 'dzin; bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni skyes nas ldongs te phung po lnga ci yin pa mi shes /
analyzed: 'jig rten @51b 'dzin; bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni skyes nas ldongs te phung po lnga ci yin pa mi shes /
translated: “Childish ordinary beings, O World-Honored One, are born blind. They do not know what the five aggregates are.

original: phung po lnga gang nas 'ongs pa'ang mi shes so //
analyzed: phung po lnga gang nas 'ongs pa'ang mi shes so //
translated: They do not know where the five aggregates come from.

original: phung po lnga'i yang dag pa ji lta ba mi shes pas phung po la chags shing 'dzin te de bas na nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i yang dag pa ji lta ba mi shes pas phung po la chags shing 'dzin te de bas na nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: They do not know the five aggregates as they really are. Therefore they are attached to and grasp the aggregates. For this reason they are called the appropriated aggregates.

original: de la len pa'ang med la len par bya ba'ang dmigs su med de /
analyzed: de la len pa'ang med la len par bya ba'ang dmigs su med de /
translated: In them there is no appropriation, and no appropriator can be found.

original: phyin ci log la chags shing yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pas bcings te /🔽ma rig pa dang / gti mug gis rmongs pas bdag len /
analyzed: phyin ci log la chags shing yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pas bcings te / ma rig pa dang / gti mug gis rmongs pas bdag len /
translated: They are bound by attachment to error and by false imagination.

original: bdag gi bar len /
analyzed: bdag gi bar len /
translated: They are confused by ignorance and delusion, and so they grasp at “I” and “mine.”

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi bar len te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi bar len te /
translated: They grasp at “I” and “other.”

original: de bas na nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called the appropriated aggregates.

original: phung po lnga la ni nye bar len pa'ang med /
analyzed: phung po lnga la ni nye bar len pa'ang med /
translated: The five aggregates are not appropriated.

original: nges pa'i mtshan nyid kyang med do //
analyzed: nges pa'i mtshan nyid kyang med do //
translated: They do not have a fixed essence.

original: de bas na mkhas pa dag ni phung po ma yin pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lngar shes so //
analyzed: de bas na mkhas pa dag ni phung po ma yin pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lngar shes so //
translated: Therefore, the wise know that the five appropriated aggregates are not aggregates.

original: phyin ci log gi phung po la nye bar len pa'i phung po lngar shes so //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi phung po la nye bar len pa'i phung po lngar shes so //
translated: They know that the five appropriated aggregates are aggregates of error.

original: ma rig pa'i phung po la nye bar len pa'i phung po lngar shes so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i phung po la nye bar len pa'i phung po lngar shes so //
translated: They know that the five appropriated aggregates are aggregates of ignorance.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni 'dis rnam par bcings pas na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la chags shing gnas /
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni 'dis rnam par bcings pas na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la chags shing gnas /
translated: Childish ordinary beings are attached to and dwell in the five appropriated aggregates because they are bound by them.

original: chags shing gnas pas na nye bar len pa ni gang nye bar len pa'i phung po ni gang yin pa mi shes te /
analyzed: chags shing gnas pas na nye bar len pa ni gang nye bar len pa'i phung po ni gang yin pa mi shes te /
translated: One does not know what is appropriated and what is the appropriator.

original: phung po lnga la chags shing gnas pas skye zhing 'khor bar gyur to //
analyzed: phung po lnga la chags shing gnas pas skye zhing 'khor bar gyur to //
translated: One is born and transmigrates due to attachment and abiding in the five aggregates.

original: phung po lnga la chags shing gnas pas rgyud kun tu 'khor bar gyur to //
analyzed: phung po lnga la chags shing gnas pas rgyud kun tu 'khor bar gyur to //
translated: One transmigrates through the continuum of the five aggregates due to attachment and abiding in the five aggregates.

original: ci la gnas shing chags zhe na /
analyzed: ci la gnas shing chags zhe na /
translated: In what does one abide and to what is one attached?

original: mthong ba la gnas shing chags /
analyzed: mthong ba la gnas shing chags /
translated: One abides in and is attached to seeing.

original: @52a *// thos pa la gnas shing chags /
analyzed: @52a *// thos pa la gnas shing chags /
translated: One abides in and is attached to hearing.

original: tshor ba la gnas shing chags /
analyzed: tshor ba la gnas shing chags /
translated: One abides in and is attached to feeling.

original: rnam par shes pa la gnas shing chags /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la gnas shing chags /
translated: One abides in and is attached to consciousness.

original: sred pa la gnas shing chags /
analyzed: sred pa la gnas shing chags /
translated: One abides in and is attached to craving.

original: ma rig pa la gnas shing chags so //
analyzed: ma rig pa la gnas shing chags so //
translated: One abides in and is attached to ignorance.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni srid pa'i 'ching bas rnam par bcings par nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la mngon par chags te sgrib pas yongs su bsgribs pas ma rig pas rmongs te mi shes mi tshor ro //
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni srid pa'i 'ching bas rnam par bcings par nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la mngon par chags te sgrib pas yongs su bsgribs pas ma rig pas rmongs te mi shes mi tshor ro //
translated: Childish ordinary beings, bound by the fetters of existence, are attached to the five appropriated aggregates. Obscured by obscurations, they are deluded by ignorance and do not know or feel.

original: bdag cag gis chags pa'i gnas ni gang yin /
analyzed: bdag cag gis chags pa'i gnas ni gang yin /
translated: We do not know what we are attached to,

original: cis bcings pa mi shes pa'i phyir sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song dang / yi dvags dang / lha dang / mir yang dang / yang du skye zhing 'khor te /
analyzed: cis bcings pa mi shes pa'i phyir sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song dang / yi dvags dang / lha dang / mir yang dang / yang du skye zhing 'khor te /
translated: nor what binds us. Therefore, we are born again and again in the realms of hell beings, animals, hungry ghosts, gods, humans, and so on, and we circle through them.

original: 'khor bas rnam par bcings pas 'khor ba la gnas shing chags te mi gtong /
analyzed: 'khor bas rnam par bcings pas 'khor ba la gnas shing chags te mi gtong /
translated: We are bound by saṃsāra, and so we remain attached to saṃsāra and do not let go.

original: mi spong / mi gcod do; ;phung po lnga'i yang dag pa ji lta ba'ang mi shes so //
analyzed: mi spong / mi gcod do; ;phung po lnga'i yang dag pa ji lta ba'ang mi shes so //
translated: We do not abandon it, nor do we cut it off. We do not know the five aggregates as they are in reality.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba'i mtshan nyid mi shes pa'i phyir sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs kyis yongs su gtses te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba'i mtshan nyid mi shes pa'i phyir sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs kyis yongs su gtses te /
translated: Because we do not know the characteristics of reality as it is, we are afflicted by various kinds of suffering.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i dong du lhung nas 'byung ba'i lam mi shes so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i dong du lhung nas 'byung ba'i lam mi shes so //
translated: Having fallen into the pit of unreality, we do not know the path of deliverance.

original: gang zag des de ltar 'byung ba'i lam mi shes pas thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'khor ba'i rgyud du 'khor ba len to //
analyzed: gang zag des de ltar 'byung ba'i lam mi shes pas thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'khor ba'i rgyud du 'khor ba len to //
translated: Because that person does not know the path of deliverance, from time without beginning he has been circling in the stream of saṃsāra.

original: de bas na skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / shi ba dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / slos pa'i mya ngan dang / sdug bsngal las rnam par ma grol /
analyzed: de bas na skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / shi ba dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / slos pa'i mya ngan dang / sdug bsngal las rnam par ma grol /
translated: Therefore, they are not liberated from birth, aging, sickness, death, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and disturbance.

original: tshad med @52b pa'i 'khor ba'i g-yang sa las rnam par ma grol /
analyzed: tshad med @52b pa'i 'khor ba'i g-yang sa las rnam par ma grol /
translated: They are not liberated from the abyss of immeasurable saṃsāra.

original: sdug bsngal chen po'i phung po las rnam par ma grol te /🔽phyir yang sdug bsngal la gnas shing chags /
analyzed: sdug bsngal chen po'i phung po las rnam par ma grol te / phyir yang sdug bsngal la gnas shing chags /
translated: They are not liberated from the mass of great suffering.🔽They are still attached to suffering.

original: sdug bsngal la mngon par chags te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la mngon par chags te /
translated: They are still attached to suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyis bkol bar gyur to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis bkol bar gyur to //
translated: They are still bound by suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang zhe na /
translated: What is suffering?

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga yin te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga yin te /
translated: It is the five appropriated aggregates.

original: skye ba'i tshe na sdug bsngal skye la /
analyzed: skye ba'i tshe na sdug bsngal skye la /
translated: When they are born, suffering is born.

original: 'gog pa'i tshe na'ang sdug bsngal 'gog go /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i tshe na'ang sdug bsngal 'gog go /
translated: When they cease, suffering ceases.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: ngas de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis slob ma rnams la 'di skad du chos bstan to //
analyzed: ngas de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis slob ma rnams la 'di skad du chos bstan to //
translated: for these reasons I taught my disciples the Dharma in this way:

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: ‘Bhikṣus,

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs kyi phung po la brtag go /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs kyi phung po la brtag go /
translated: You should investigate the aggregate of form as it truly is.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: You should understand the characteristic of impermanence of form as it truly is.

original: khyed ci ste gzugs la chags par gyur na de ma thag tu bsal cing gcad par bya'o; ;khyed la sogs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: khyed ci ste gzugs la chags par gyur na de ma thag tu bsal cing gcad par bya'o; ;khyed la sogs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la brtag par bya'o //
translated: If you become attached to form, you should immediately eliminate and cut it off. You and the others should investigate feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness as they truly are.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: You should understand the characteristic of impermanence of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness as it truly is.

original: ci ste tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la chags par gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la chags par gyur na /
translated: If you become attached to feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness,

original: de ma thag tu bsal cing gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: de ma thag tu bsal cing gcad par bya'o //
translated: you should immediately eliminate and cut it off.

original: chags babs  la cing bcad pas sems yang dag par rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chags babs  la cing bcad pas sems yang dag par rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By cutting off attachment, the mind will be completely liberated.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: @53a *// gang zag su zhig ngas gsungs pa'i chos kyi don shes shing ji ltar gsungs pa bzhin du nan tan byed na skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / yid blong ba dang /
analyzed: @53a *// gang zag su zhig ngas gsungs pa'i chos kyi don shes shing ji ltar gsungs pa bzhin du nan tan byed na skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / yid blong ba dang /
translated: if someone understands the meaning of the Dharma I have taught and practices it as taught, they will be liberated from birth, aging, sickness, death, lamentation, unhappiness,

original: sdug bsngal las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and suffering.

original: gang zag su zhig ngas gsungs pa bzhin du mi spyod mi sgom na gzugs kyi 'ching bas rnam par bcings /
analyzed: gang zag su zhig ngas gsungs pa bzhin du mi spyod mi sgom na gzugs kyi 'ching bas rnam par bcings /
translated: If someone does not practice or cultivate as I have taught, they will be bound by the fetters of form

original: sred pa'i 'ching bas rnam par bcings pa yin te /
analyzed: sred pa'i 'ching bas rnam par bcings pa yin te /
translated: and the fetters of craving.

original: ma rig pas ldongs pas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la chags so //
analyzed: ma rig pas ldongs pas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la chags so //
translated: Because of ignorance, they will be attached to the five appropriated aggregates.

original: gang zag de nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la chags pas 'khor ba'i g-yang sa las rnam par ma grol to //
analyzed: gang zag de nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la chags pas 'khor ba'i g-yang sa las rnam par ma grol to //
translated: Because that person is attached to the five appropriated aggregates, they will not be liberated from the abyss of saṃsāra.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: de lta bas na 'jig rten pa dag ning dang rtsod kyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'jig rten pa dag ning dang rtsod kyi /
translated: Therefore, I do not dispute with the world.

original: nga ni 'jig rten pa dag dang mi rtsod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nga ni 'jig rten pa dag dang mi rtsod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: The world disputes with me.

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What is the world?

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la chags pa ni 'jig rten zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la chags pa ni 'jig rten zhes bya'o //
translated: It is attachment to the five appropriative aggregates.

original: gang zag de phung po lnga la chags te /
analyzed: gang zag de phung po lnga la chags te /
translated: The person who is attached to the five aggregates,

original: phung po lngas rnam par bcings pas phung po lnga'i rang bzhin mi shes phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du mi shes te nga  dang rtsod do //
analyzed: phung po lngas rnam par bcings pas phung po lnga'i rang bzhin mi shes phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du mi shes te nga  dang rtsod do //
translated: who is bound by the five aggregates, does not understand the nature of the five aggregates, does not understand the emptiness of the five aggregates’ characteristics, and disputes with me.

original: gang zag de sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa dang 'gal bar byed de /
analyzed: gang zag de sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa dang 'gal bar byed de /
translated: That person contradicts what the Buddha taught.

original: sangs rgyas dang rtsod pas shin tu nyam nga ba chen por lhung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang rtsod pas shin tu nyam nga ba chen por lhung ngo //
translated: Disputing with the Buddha, he falls into a great abyss.

original: gang zag su zhig de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten na bzhugs kyang rung /
analyzed: gang zag su zhig de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten na bzhugs kyang rung /
translated: If a person, whether the Tathāgata is living in the world

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das @53b kyang rung /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das @53b kyang rung /
translated: or has entered complete nirvāṇa,

original: de ltar phung po lnga la yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / stong pa ci'ang med de /
analyzed: de ltar phung po lnga la yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / stong pa ci'ang med de /
translated: In this way, the five aggregates are not real, and they are empty and nonexistent.

original: phyin ci log dang / ma rig pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu brtags pa las skyes te bus pa so so'i skye po dag bslus pa yin par rtogs na phung po ma yin pa la phung po lnga dang 'dra bar shes so //
analyzed: phyin ci log dang / ma rig pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu brtags pa las skyes te bus pa so so'i skye po dag bslus pa yin par rtogs na phung po ma yin pa la phung po lnga dang 'dra bar shes so //
translated: If one realizes that they arise from error, ignorance, and unreal imagination, and that they deceive the childish ordinary beings, then one will understand that the five aggregates are like something that is not an aggregate.

original: gang zag de ni sangs rgyas dang yang mi rtsod pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag de ni sangs rgyas dang yang mi rtsod pa ste /
translated: Such a person does not dispute with the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa dang 'gal bar mi byed pas sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song dang / yi dvags kyi sdug bsngal las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa dang 'gal bar mi byed pas sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song dang / yi dvags kyi sdug bsngal las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they do not contradict what the buddhas have said, they will be liberated from the sufferings of hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapālas,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni gang zag dang mi rtsod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni gang zag dang mi rtsod do //
translated: the buddhas, the blessed ones, do not dispute with persons.

original: rtsod pa thams cad yongs su bcad pas sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rtsod pa thams cad yongs su bcad pas sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
translated: Because they have resolved all disputes, they are called buddhas.

original: sems can thams cad la yang dag pa'i chos ston to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la yang dag pa'i chos ston to //
translated: They teach the true Dharma to all sentient beings.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: khyed kyis sngon blangs pa ni thams cad kyang phyin ci log yin te /
analyzed: khyed kyis sngon blangs pa ni thams cad kyang phyin ci log yin te /
translated: All that you have previously taken up is mistaken.

original: sems can thams cad phyin ci log gi dbang gis phung po la chags shing gnas nas 'jig rten du yang dang / yang 'khor bar gyur to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad phyin ci log gi dbang gis phung po la chags shing gnas nas 'jig rten du yang dang / yang 'khor bar gyur to //
translated: Because of their mistaken views, sentient beings are attached to the five aggregates and remain so, and thus they revolve again and again in the world.

original: de ltar gang zag dag phung po lnga la chags shing gnas pas ngan par lta ba rnam pa sna tshogs la zhen cing bskyed do //
analyzed: de ltar gang zag dag phung po lnga la chags shing gnas pas ngan par lta ba rnam pa sna tshogs la zhen cing bskyed do //
translated: In this way, because of their attachment to the five aggregates, individuals develop and cling to various mistaken views.

original: ming dang / tshig rnam pa sna tshogs la chags shing gnas slos pa'i mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal thams cad la chags shing gnas so //🔽de ltar gang zag dag ngan par lta ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyis nyon @54a *//
analyzed: ming dang / tshig rnam pa sna tshogs la chags shing gnas slos pa'i mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal thams cad la chags shing gnas so // de ltar gang zag dag ngan par lta ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyis nyon @54a *//
translated: They are attached to and remain attached to various names and phrases, and thus they are attached to and remain attached to all suffering, lamentation, and pain.

original: mongs / sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs yongs su gtses kyang de'i mgon byed pa'am /🔽skyabs byed pa'am /
analyzed: mongs / sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs yongs su gtses kyang de'i mgon byed pa'am / skyabs byed pa'am /
translated: In this way, individuals are afflicted by various mistaken views and are tormented by various sufferings and pains.🔽But there is no one to protect them,

original: gnas dang / rten du 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: gnas dang / rten du 'gyur ba med de /
translated: no one to be their refuge,🔽and no one to be their support.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyag cig ni mgon dang skyabs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyag cig ni mgon dang skyabs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Only the Buddha, the Bhagavān, is the protector and refuge.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni sems chung /
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni sems chung /
translated: “Childish ordinary beings have small minds.

original: shes pa chung bas 'dod pa lnga la chags /
analyzed: shes pa chung bas 'dod pa lnga la chags /
translated: They have small knowledge and are attached to the five desires.

original: nyes pa'i skyon mang po'i phung po lnga la chags so //
analyzed: nyes pa'i skyon mang po'i phung po lnga la chags so //
translated: They are attached to the five aggregates, which are a mass of many faults.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni mgon du 'gyur ba dang / skyabs su 'gyur ba dang / gnas dang / rten du 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal thams cad las rnam par grol bar byed pa dang / rtsod par byed do //
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag ni mgon du 'gyur ba dang / skyabs su 'gyur ba dang / gnas dang / rten du 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal thams cad las rnam par grol bar byed pa dang / rtsod par byed do //
translated: Childish ordinary beings argue about who is the protector, who is the refuge, who is the basis, who is the support, and who can liberate them from all suffering.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: ngas phyag bteg pa yin no //
analyzed: ngas phyag bteg pa yin no //
translated: I have raised my hand.

original: gang zhig phung po lngar lta ba dang / phung po lnga la mtshan mar lta ba dang; phung po lnga la chags par byed na nga'ang de'i ston pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig phung po lngar lta ba dang / phung po lnga la mtshan mar lta ba dang; phung po lnga la chags par byed na nga'ang de'i ston pa ma yin la /
translated: If one views the five aggregates, views the five aggregates as characteristics, and becomes attached to the five aggregates, I am not their teacher,

original: de'ang nga'i slob ma ma yin te /🔽nga'i rjes su rab tu byung ba ma yin /
analyzed: de'ang nga'i slob ma ma yin te / nga'i rjes su rab tu byung ba ma yin /
translated: and they are not my disciples.🔽They have not gone forth in my name,

original: nga'i rjes su spyod pa ma yin /
analyzed: nga'i rjes su spyod pa ma yin /
translated: they do not practice in accordance with me,

original: nga la skyabs su song ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nga la skyabs su song ba ma yin gyi /
translated: They are not my followers.

original: gang zag de ni ngan par 'gro ba'i lam du song pa /
analyzed: gang zag de ni ngan par 'gro ba'i lam du song pa /
translated: Such people have entered a path that leads to evil destinies.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lam la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lam la zhugs pa'o //
translated: They have entered a path that is not the right one.

original: yang dag pa len pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa len pa ma yin te /
translated: They do not take up the right path.

original: phyin ci log pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log pa'o //
translated: They are mistaken.

original: sangs rgyas kyis dgongs te gsungs pa mi shes /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis dgongs te gsungs pa mi shes /
translated: They do not understand the Buddha’s teachings that are expressed with an underlying intent.

original: sangs rgyas kyis phung po lnga ci la dgongs te gsungs pa mi shes /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis phung po lnga ci la dgongs te gsungs pa mi shes /
translated: They do not understand the five aggregates as they were taught by the Buddha with an underlying intent.🔽They do not understand the Buddha’s teachings on ultimate reality.

original: sangs rgyas kyi don dam pa gsungs pa'i shes @54b so; ;gang zag de ltar sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'i rjes su mi 'jug pas mchod pa dang / rnye pa blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi don dam pa gsungs pa'i shes @54b so; ;gang zag de ltar sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'i rjes su mi 'jug pas mchod pa dang / rnye pa blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Since such people do not follow the Buddha’s teachings, they should not accept worship or material support.

original: gang zag de ni rab tu 'byung bar ngas ma gnang na gzhan gyi mchod pa dang / rnyed pa'i bkur sti len pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang zag de ni rab tu 'byung bar ngas ma gnang na gzhan gyi mchod pa dang / rnyed pa'i bkur sti len pa lta ci smos /
translated: I do not allow such people to go forth, let alone accept worship, material support, and honors from others.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: gang zag de ni mu stegs can gyi sder gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zag de ni mu stegs can gyi sder gtogs pa yin no //
translated: Because such people belong to the class of non-Buddhists.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: gang phung po lnga la mtshan ma skyed pa ni phung po lnga la chags shing 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang phung po lnga la mtshan ma skyed pa ni phung po lnga la chags shing 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Generating characteristics of the five aggregates is called attachment to and grasping at the five aggregates.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus lnga brgya'i tha ma la dam pa'i chos rnam par 'jig pa'i tshe /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus lnga brgya'i tha ma la dam pa'i chos rnam par 'jig pa'i tshe /
translated: in the future, during the final five hundred years, when the true Dharma is being destroyed,

original: nga'i chos la rab tu byung ba rnams mang du phung po lnga la mtshan ma skyed pa dang / phung po lnga'i mtshan ma la nges par gcad pa dang / phung po lnga la rab tu chags te /
analyzed: nga'i chos la rab tu byung ba rnams mang du phung po lnga la mtshan ma skyed pa dang / phung po lnga'i mtshan ma la nges par gcad pa dang / phung po lnga la rab tu chags te /
translated: those who have gone forth in my teachings will generate characteristics of the five aggregates, will be fixated on the characteristics of the five aggregates, and will be attached to the five aggregates.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lam ngan par zhugs pas nga'i chos la rab tu byung bas chos gos gnya' ba la bkal te rtag tu khyim pa'i khyim du 'gro ba la dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lam ngan par zhugs pas nga'i chos la rab tu byung bas chos gos gnya' ba la bkal te rtag tu khyim pa'i khyim du 'gro ba la dga' bar byed do //
translated: They will follow false, evil paths. Those who have gone forth in my teachings will wear their Dharma robes draped over their necks and will always enjoy going to the homes of laypeople.

original: gang zag de ni mu stegs can dang tha mi dad kyang nga'i chos kyi byin gyis de la mchod pa dang / sbyin pa mang bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag de ni mu stegs can dang tha mi dad kyang nga'i chos kyi byin gyis de la mchod pa dang / sbyin pa mang bar rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that such people are no different from tīrthikas, and that they will receive offerings and be given gifts due to the blessings of my teachings.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: gang phung po lngar lta ba dang / phung po lnga la nges pa'i 'chad pa dang / phung po lnga la chags par byed pa de ni gzhan dag gi chu phor gang tsam yang len du mi dbang bar ngas bshad do //
analyzed: gang phung po lngar lta ba dang / phung po lnga la nges pa'i 'chad pa dang / phung po lnga la chags par byed pa de ni gzhan dag gi chu phor gang tsam yang len du mi dbang bar ngas bshad do //
translated: I say that those who view the five aggregates, who explain the five aggregates, and who are attached to the five aggregates are not even allowed to receive a single bowl of water from others.

original: de ci ste zhen /🔽gang zag des nga'i chos la mthun pa'i chos kyi bzod pa tsam yang med pas gang zag de ni nga'i chos dang @55a *//
analyzed: de ci ste zhen / gang zag des nga'i chos la mthun pa'i chos kyi bzod pa tsam yang med pas gang zag de ni nga'i chos dang @55a *//
translated: Why is this?

original: 'gal bar byed pa /
analyzed: 'gal bar byed pa /
translated: Because such people do not even have the mere acceptance of the Dharma that accords with my Dharma. Such people are acting in opposition to my Dharma.

original: 'phags pa'i chos yongs su spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos yongs su spong ba'o //
translated: They are abandoning the Dharma of the noble ones.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokadhara,

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ma 'ongs pa'i dus ngan par de lta bu'i dam bcas te smon lam chen po btab ste /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ma 'ongs pa'i dus ngan par de lta bu'i dam bcas te smon lam chen po btab ste /
translated: therefore, bodhisattva mahāsattvas in future degenerate times should make such vows and aspirations.

original: nga'i shin tu zab mo'i mdo sde dag gzung zhing bsrung ba dang / sems can dag phung po lngar lta ba gcad pa'i phyir chos bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: nga'i shin tu zab mo'i mdo sde dag gzung zhing bsrung ba dang / sems can dag phung po lngar lta ba gcad pa'i phyir chos bstan par bya'o //
translated: They should uphold and protect my extremely profound sūtras and teach the Dharma in order to sever sentient beings’ views of the five aggregates.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokadhara,

original: de bas na ngas mdo sde kun las phung po'i mtshan ma thams cad gzhig pa dang / phung po la chags pa spang ba bshad de; de'i tshe khyim na gnas pa dang / rab tu byung ba dag mang du mdo sde 'di la rtsod ba byung ste /
analyzed: de bas na ngas mdo sde kun las phung po'i mtshan ma thams cad gzhig pa dang / phung po la chags pa spang ba bshad de; de'i tshe khyim na gnas pa dang / rab tu byung ba dag mang du mdo sde 'di la rtsod ba byung ste /
translated: Therefore, I have explained in all the sutras the destruction of all the characteristics of the aggregates and the abandonment of attachment to the aggregates. At that time, there were many debates among householders and renunciants about this sutra.

original: yang dag pa nyid du 'du shes mi skyed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du 'du shes mi skyed do //
translated: They do not give rise to the perception of what is true.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'di ltar yi dam dang / smon la ma chen po gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'di ltar yi dam dang / smon la ma chen po gdab par bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas should make this kind of vow and great aspiration:

original: bdag cag gis ma 'ongs pa'i dus ngan pa'i sems can phung po la chags shing ngan par lta ba la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don gyi phyir /
analyzed: bdag cag gis ma 'ongs pa'i dus ngan pa'i sems can phung po la chags shing ngan par lta ba la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don gyi phyir /
translated: 'For the sake of benefiting and bringing happiness to the sentient beings of the future evil age who are attached to the aggregates and have wrong views,

original: phung po lnga la chags pa bsal ba'i phyir ji lta ji lta bu rang dul bde lta de lta bu'i chos kyis phan pa dang / bde ba'i don byed do //
analyzed: phung po lnga la chags pa bsal ba'i phyir ji lta ji lta bu rang dul bde lta de lta bu'i chos kyis phan pa dang / bde ba'i don byed do //
translated: in order to eliminate attachment to the five aggregates, we will, in whatever way we are disciplined, bring benefit and happiness through the Dharma in that very way.'

original: de bas na 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Therefore, Lokapāla,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang zhig chos rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba shes par 'dod pa dang / chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnam @55b par 'byed pa la mkhas par 'dod pa dang / dran pa'i mthu thob par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang zhig chos rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba shes par 'dod pa dang / chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnam @55b par 'byed pa la mkhas par 'dod pa dang / dran pa'i mthu thob par 'dod pa dang /
translated: “Bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to know the suchness of phenomena, who wish to be skilled in discerning the characteristics of phenomena, who wish to attain the power of memory,

original: chos thams cad kyi rnam grangs rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pa'i shes rab 'dod pa dang / lus 'di bor nas nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dran pa thob par 'dod pa dag nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rnam grangs rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pa'i shes rab 'dod pa dang / lus 'di bor nas nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dran pa thob par 'dod pa dag nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: who wish for the wisdom that is skilled in discerning the categories of all phenomena, and who wish to attain uninterrupted mindfulness from the time they abandon this body until they attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should contemplate the five appropriated aggregates as having the characteristic of impermanence,

original: sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid dang / bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dang / snying po med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mthar stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / thog pa med pa'i dus nas ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid du brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid dang / bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dang / snying po med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mthar stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / thog pa med pa'i dus nas ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid du brtag par bya'o //
translated: You should investigate the characteristics of suffering, the characteristics of selflessness, the characteristics of unreality, the characteristics of essencelessness, the characteristics of ultimate emptiness, and the characteristics of unbornness since time immemorial.

original: rtag tu yang dag pa ji lha ba bzhin du rtog pa na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la chags shing zhen pa yongs su sel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yang dag pa ji lha ba bzhin du rtog pa na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la chags shing zhen pa yongs su sel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you always contemplate in accordance with reality, you will be able to eliminate attachment and clinging to the five appropriated aggregates.

original: gzhan yang / de lta bu'i shin tu zab mo'i chos la sbyor ba'ang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang / de lta bu'i shin tu zab mo'i chos la sbyor ba'ang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, you will also attain the practice of such profound Dharma.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapala,

original: sngon bskal pa tshad med grangs med pa 'das pa de'i tshe de'i dus na blo gros chen po ri'i rgyal po zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
analyzed: sngon bskal pa tshad med grangs med pa 'das pa de'i tshe de'i dus na blo gros chen po ri'i rgyal po zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
translated: in the past, immeasurable and incalculable eons ago, there was a thus-come one, a worthy one, a perfect buddha called Great Intelligence King of Mountains.

original: mkhyen pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
analyzed: mkhyen pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: He was endowed with knowledge and virtue,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: a sugata,

original: 'jig rten rig pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten rig pa /
translated: a knower of the world,

original: bla na med pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa /
translated: unsurpassed,

original: skyes bu 'dul zhing kha lo sgyur ba /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul zhing kha lo sgyur ba /
translated: a charioteer who tames beings,

original: lha dang / mi'i ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du byung ngo //
analyzed: lha dang / mi'i ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du byung ngo //
translated: a blessed buddha, a teacher of gods and humans.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: @56a *// bcom ldan 'das blo gros chen po ri'i rgyal po de la nyan thos kyi dge 'dun khrag khrig phrag brgyad cu yod de /
analyzed: @56a *// bcom ldan 'das blo gros chen po ri'i rgyal po de la nyan thos kyi dge 'dun khrag khrig phrag brgyad cu yod de /
translated: the Blessed One Mahāmati­giri­rāja had an assembly of 800 million śrāvakas,

original: thams cad kyang dgra bcom pa /
analyzed: thams cad kyang dgra bcom pa /

analyzed: shing de dag kyang rin po che'i gos kyi shing sha stag go /

analyzed: skyed mos tshal de dag re re na'ang rin po che'i rdzing lnga brgya lnga brgya yod de /

analyzed: yon tan brgyad kyi chus yongs su gang ngo //
translated: filled with water possessing the eight good qualities.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /

analyzed: rgyal po phan par 'gyur ba de la btsun mo dang / pho brang gi slas brgyad khri snyed yod de /

analyzed: de'i tshe btsun mo chen mo de la sras gnyis yod do // gcig ni tshad med blo gros zhes bya /

original: gcig ni tshad med stobs zhes bya /
analyzed: gcig ni tshad med stobs zhes bya /
translated: and the other was named Amitabala.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokapāla,

analyzed: rgyal bu de gnyis lo bcu drug lon pa dang rmi lam du de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ste /
translated: when the two princes were sixteen years old, they saw the Tathāgata in a dream.

original: shin tu mdzes pa /
analyzed: shin tu mdzes pa /
translated: He was extremely handsome,

original: dpe zla med pas na /
analyzed: dpe zla med pas na /
translated: and incomparable.

analyzed: dzambu chu klung gi gser gyi rgyal mtshan lta bu mthong nas rab tu dga' ste sad pa dang / so so nas tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so //
translated: When they saw him, they were overjoyed, and they awoke. Each of them spoke these verses:

original: phu bos smras pa /
analyzed: phu bos smras pa /
translated: The elder brother said:

original: bdag gis rkang gnyis mchog ni mthong bar rmis //
analyzed: bdag gis rkang gnyis mchog ni mthong bar rmis //
translated: “I dreamed that I saw the supreme human,

analyzed: gser mdog bsod nams brgya yi mtshan gyis brgyan //
translated: Golden in color, adorned with the marks of hundreds of merits,

original: tshad med pa yi yon tan yongs rdzogs pa //
analyzed: tshad med pa yi yon tan yongs rdzogs pa //
translated: Perfect in immeasurable qualities,

original: mthong bas sems ni rab tu dga' bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mthong bas sems ni rab tu dga' bar 'gyur //
translated: And my mind was filled with joy at the sight.”

original: nu bos smras pa /
analyzed: nu bos smras pa /
translated: The younger brother said:

original: bdag gis sangs rgyas nyi ltar lham ba rmis /
analyzed: bdag gis sangs rgyas nyi ltar lham ba rmis /
translated: “I dreamed of the Buddha, shining like the sun,

original: shin tu bzang zhing mdzes pa phul gyi mchog /
analyzed: shin tu bzang zhing mdzes pa phul gyi mchog /
translated: Extremely good and beautiful, the best of the best,

original: ri yi rgyal po ri rab ji bzhin te //
analyzed: ri yi rgyal po ri rab ji bzhin te //
translated: Like Mount Sumeru, king of mountains,

original: lhang der gsal bar mthong bas shin tu dga'//
analyzed: lhang der gsal bar mthong bas shin tu dga'//
translated: And I was overjoyed at the clear sight.”

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /🔽de'i tshe na rgyal bu tshad med blo gros dang / tshad med @57a *//
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin / de'i tshe na rgyal bu tshad med blo gros dang / tshad med @57a *//
translated: “Lokapālas,

original: stobs gnyis pha ma gang na bar song nas /
analyzed: stobs gnyis pha ma gang na bar song nas /

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:🔽🔽

analyzed: bdag cag gis 'di lta bu dag rmi lam du mthong ngo zhes rmi lam gyi gtam pha ma la bzlas so //
translated: We have seen such things in our dreams.” They told their parents about the dream.

original: bdag cag gnyis kyis sangs rgyas mthong bar rmis kyi /
analyzed: bdag cag gnyis kyis sangs rgyas mthong bar rmis kyi /
translated: “We dreamed of seeing the Buddha.

original: bdag cag gnyis bcom ldan 'das gang na bar mchi bar gsol /
analyzed: bdag cag gnyis bcom ldan 'das gang na bar mchi bar gsol /
translated: We request to go to where the Bhagavān is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du 'byung ba'ang shin tu dka' ste; bdag cag bag med pas ma tshor ma 'tshal nas 'dod pa lnga'i 'dam du lhung ste gzugs kyi 'ching bas rnam par bcings so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du 'byung ba'ang shin tu dka' ste; bdag cag bag med pas ma tshor ma 'tshal nas 'dod pa lnga'i 'dam du lhung ste gzugs kyi 'ching bas rnam par bcings so //
translated: The appearance of a tathāgata in the world is extremely rare. We were heedless and did not know. We fell into the mud of the five desires and were bound by the fetters of form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du bshes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i bcings pas rnam par bcings so //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du bshes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i bcings pas rnam par bcings so //
translated: We were bound by the fetters of sensation, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: bdag cag khyim na gnas pas bag med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas ma mthong ngo zhes gsol to //
analyzed: bdag cag khyim na gnas pas bag med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas ma mthong ngo zhes gsol to //
translated: We did not see the Buddha because we were heedless while living in the household.”

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: “Lokapālas,

original: rgyal bu de gnyis kyis pha ma la de skad ces smras nas bcom ldan 'das blo gros chen po ri'i rgyal po gang na ba der song ngo //
analyzed: rgyal bu de gnyis kyis pha ma la de skad ces smras nas bcom ldan 'das blo gros chen po ri'i rgyal po gang na ba der song ngo //
translated: After the two princes had spoken thus to their parents, they went to the place where the Bhagavat Mahāmati was.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar phyin nas zhabs la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar phyin nas zhabs la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Having arrived in the presence of the Bhagavat, they bowed their heads to his feet,

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams la zla ba gsum gyi bar du mchod pa rnam bzhi 'bul bar spyan drangs so //
translated: and invited the Buddha and the community of monks to a four-month offering.

original: na bza' dang / bsod snyoms dang / gzims cha dang / snyun gyi rkyen sman dag gis mchod cing phul te /
analyzed: na bza' dang / bsod snyoms dang / gzims cha dang / snyun gyi rkyen sman dag gis mchod cing phul te /
translated: They made offerings and presented them with robes, alms, bedding, and medicine for the sick.

original: grong khyer chen po'i mtha' rgyal po phan par 'gyur ba'i skyed mos tshal gcig tu ba dan dbyangs /
analyzed: grong khyer chen po'i mtha' rgyal po phan par 'gyur ba'i skyed mos tshal gcig tu ba dan dbyangs /
translated: In a park outside the great city, the king’s park called Anupamā, they erected banners,

original: gdugs @57b bres; rin po che'i padmo bkod de /
analyzed: gdugs @57b bres; rin po che'i padmo bkod de /
translated: unfurled canopies, and arranged jeweled lotuses.

original: sangs rgyas dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun la phul nas bzhugs su gsol to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun la phul nas bzhugs su gsol to //
translated: They invited the Buddha and the community of monks to sit there and made offerings to them.

original: rgyal bu de gnyis kyis zla ba gsum gyi bar du mchod pa'i yo byad thams cad kyis sangs rgyas dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun la mchod nas bcom ldan 'das de'i bstan pa la khyim nas khyim ma yin par rab tu byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyal bu de gnyis kyis zla ba gsum gyi bar du mchod pa'i yo byad thams cad kyis sangs rgyas dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun la mchod nas bcom ldan 'das de'i bstan pa la khyim nas khyim ma yin par rab tu byung ngo //
translated: For three months, the two princes made offerings to the Buddha and the saṅgha of monks with all kinds of offering articles. After that, they left home to go forth in the teachings of that Bhagavān.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: bcom ldan 'das blo gros chen po ri'i rgyal po des rgyal bu de gnyis kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / sman pa mkhyen nas phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i thabs zhes bya ba'i mdo rgyas par bshad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das blo gros chen po ri'i rgyal po des rgyal bu de gnyis kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / sman pa mkhyen nas phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i thabs zhes bya ba'i mdo rgyas par bshad do //
translated: the Bhagavān Mahāmati-giri-rāja, knowing the superior intention of the two princes, extensively explained the Sūtra of the Bodhisattva’s Skillful Means, which explains the five aggregates, the twelve sense bases, and the eighteen elements.

original: lo bzhi khri'i bar du gnyid kyang ma log /
analyzed: lo bzhi khri'i bar du gnyid kyang ma log /
translated: For forty thousand years, they did not sleep.

original: zas kyang chog par ma zos /🔽snyes te 'phres kyang ma myong bar gal te 'dug gam /
analyzed: zas kyang chog par ma zos / snyes te 'phres kyang ma myong bar gal te 'dug gam /
translated: They did not eat enough food.

original: 'chag cing song yang ma myong ngo //
analyzed: 'chag cing song yang ma myong ngo //
translated: They did not experience lying down or sitting, and they did not experience walking or moving.

original: de nas yang lo bzhi khri'i bar du gzhan ci'ang mi sems te /
analyzed: de nas yang lo bzhi khri'i bar du gzhan ci'ang mi sems te /
translated: Then for another forty thousand years he did not think of anything else.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / stong pan yid kyi mtshan nyid du sems so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / stong pan yid kyi mtshan nyid du sems so //
translated: He contemplated the five appropriated aggregates as unreal and empty, as having the characteristic of mind.🔽Thus, knowing that the five aggregates arise from error, he began to understand and realize the characteristic of the five appropriated aggregates.

original: de ltar phung po lnga phyin ci log las byung bar shes nas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid khong du chud cing rtogs par bya ba la brtsams bzhin du tshe la thug gi bar du tshangs par spyad pa spyod do //
analyzed: de ltar phung po lnga phyin ci log las byung bar shes nas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid khong du chud cing rtogs par bya ba la brtsams bzhin du tshe la thug gi bar du tshangs par spyad pa spyod do //
translated: He practiced pure conduct for the rest of his life.

original: de nas tshe 'phos nas dga' ldan gnas su skyes so //
analyzed: de nas tshe 'phos nas dga' ldan gnas su skyes so //
translated: Then, after his life ended, he was reborn in the Tuṣita realm.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu phyir yang dzambu gling 'dir khyim bdag chen @58a *//
translated: After the Blessed One’s parinirvāṇa, he was reborn in this world in the home of a great householder.

original: po zhig gi khyim du skyes nas lo bcu drug lon pa dang / yang rmi lam na de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ste /
analyzed: po zhig gi khyim du skyes nas lo bcu drug lon pa dang / yang rmi lam na de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ste /
translated: When he was sixteen years old, he again dreamed of seeing the Tathāgata.

original: phung po lnga dang / khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i thabs kyi mdo sde bstan par rmis so //
analyzed: phung po lnga dang / khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i thabs kyi mdo sde bstan par rmis so //
translated: He dreamed that he heard the Bodhisattva Skill-in-Means Sutra, which explains the five aggregates and the eighteen elements.

original: rmi lam na chos 'di thos nas sad pa dang / dngangs skrag ste /
analyzed: rmi lam na chos 'di thos nas sad pa dang / dngangs skrag ste /
translated: When he awoke from the dream, he was frightened.

original: bcom ldan 'das de'i bstan pa la lo khri tshang bar tshangs par spyad pa spyod cing phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i thabs kyi mdo sde zhib tu brtags nas de nas tshe 'phos te sum cu rtsa gsum gnam du skyes so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de'i bstan pa la lo khri tshang bar tshangs par spyad pa spyod cing phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad bshad pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i thabs kyi mdo sde zhib tu brtags nas de nas tshe 'phos te sum cu rtsa gsum gnam du skyes so //
translated: He practiced pure conduct for ten thousand years in the doctrine of that Blessed One, and after thoroughly investigating the Bodhisattva Skill-in-Means Sutra, which explains the five aggregates, the twelve sense-spheres, and the eighteen elements, he passed away and was reborn in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: lha'i tshe zad nas phyir yang dzambu gling du rigs mtho zhing che ba'i bram ze'i khyim du skyes so //
analyzed: lha'i tshe zad nas phyir yang dzambu gling du rigs mtho zhing che ba'i bram ze'i khyim du skyes so //
translated: When his life as a god was over, he was reborn in the human realm in a high and great brahmin family.

original: bcom ldan 'das blo gros chen po ri'i rgyal po'i chos rnam par zhig nas lo stong lon te rgyal bu de gnyis sngon gyi rgyu dang / rkyen gyis der yang rab tu byung nas shes rab rgya mtsho dang 'dra bar shes pa shin tu rgya che bar gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das blo gros chen po ri'i rgyal po'i chos rnam par zhig nas lo stong lon te rgyal bu de gnyis sngon gyi rgyu dang / rkyen gyis der yang rab tu byung nas shes rab rgya mtsho dang 'dra bar shes pa shin tu rgya che bar gyur te /
translated: Bhagavān, a thousand years after the passing of the Dharma of Mahāmati, the king of mountains, the two princes, due to their previous causes and conditions, went forth there and their wisdom became as vast as the ocean.

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid rnam par 'byed cing shin tu rtog pa la mkhas pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mngon sum du rtogs par gyur to //
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid rnam par 'byed cing shin tu rtog pa la mkhas pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mngon sum du rtogs par gyur to //
translated: They became skilled in discerning and thoroughly contemplating the characteristics of the aggregates, and directly realized the truth just as it is.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: de na mi nyi khri snyed dang / lha khri phrag nyi shu snyed bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bkod do //
analyzed: de na mi nyi khri snyed dang / lha khri phrag nyi shu snyed bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bkod do //
translated: twenty thousand people and two hundred thousand gods were established in unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de gnyis @58b kyis de nas gang nas gang du skye ba'i gnas thams cad du sems can mthun par gyur nas sangs rgyas khrag khrig khri phrag bcu dang phrad de bsnyen bkur byas par gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de gnyis @58b kyis de nas gang nas gang du skye ba'i gnas thams cad du sems can mthun par gyur nas sangs rgyas khrag khrig khri phrag bcu dang phrad de bsnyen bkur byas par gyur to //
translated: In all the places where these two bodhisattvas were born, they were in accord with sentient beings and encountered ten trillion buddhas, whom they served and revered.

original: de nas gdod mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas gdod mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: Only then did they attain acceptance of the nonarising of dharmas.

original: mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa thob nas /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa thob nas /
translated: Having attained acceptance of the nonarising of dharmas,

original: gzhan yang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig khri phrag gcig dang phrad de /
analyzed: gzhan yang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig khri phrag gcig dang phrad de /
translated: they encountered another trillion buddhas.

original: de nas gdod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas gdod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Only then did they attain unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de gnyis kyang bskal pa gcig tu rim gyis 'tshang rgya ste /🔽gcig ni tshad med dbyangs zhes bya /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang bskal pa gcig tu rim gyis 'tshang rgya ste / gcig ni tshad med dbyangs zhes bya /
translated: The two of them attained buddhahood in sequence in a single eon.🔽One was named Amitaghoṣa,

original: gcig ni tshad med 'od ces bya'o //
analyzed: gcig ni tshad med 'od ces bya'o //
translated: and the other was named Amitābha.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokapālas,

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams gang myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod pa dag rnam par dag cing shin tu byang ba'i chos bsgom pa la shin tu brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams gang myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod pa dag rnam par dag cing shin tu byang ba'i chos bsgom pa la shin tu brtson par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to quickly attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment should be diligent in cultivating pure and completely purified dharmas.

original: gzhan yang / phung po'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa dang / 'dus byas kyi chos kyi yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid la mkhas par bya'o; ;phung po lnga la brtag pa'i le'u ste gnyis so ////
analyzed: gzhan yang / phung po'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa dang / 'dus byas kyi chos kyi yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid la mkhas par bya'o; ;phung po lnga la brtag pa'i le'u ste gnyis so ////
translated: Moreover, one should penetrate the characteristics of the aggregates and be skilled in the true characteristics of conditioned phenomena. This is the second chapter on the investigation of the five aggregates.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /🔽de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams khams bco brgyad la mkhas pa zhe na /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams khams bco brgyad la yang dag par rtog par sbyor ba na 'di snyam du mig gi khams zhes @59a *//
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin / de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams khams bco brgyad la mkhas pa zhe na / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams khams bco brgyad la yang dag par rtog par sbyor ba na 'di snyam du mig gi khams zhes @59a *//
translated: Lokapāla,🔽how are bodhisattva mahāsattvas skilled in the eighteen elements?

original: bya ba mig gi khams su dmigs su med /
analyzed: bya ba mig gi khams su dmigs su med /
translated: When bodhisattva mahāsattvas apply themselves to the correct understanding of the eighteen elements, they think like this: 'What is called the eye element cannot be apprehended as the eye element.

original: mig gi khams la bdag dang / bdag gi ba med pa /🔽mi rtag pa /
analyzed: mig gi khams la bdag dang / bdag gi ba med pa / mi rtag pa /
translated: The eye element is devoid of a self and what belongs to a self.🔽It is impermanent.

original: snying po med pa /
analyzed: snying po med pa /
translated: It is insubstantial.🔽It is empty by nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir mig gi khams la mig gi mtshan nyid du btags pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir mig gi khams la mig gi mtshan nyid du btags pa mi dmigs /
translated: The eye element is not apprehended as the characteristic of the eye element.

original: mig gi khams ni yang dag pa ma yin pa ci'ang med pa ste /
analyzed: mig gi khams ni yang dag pa ma yin pa ci'ang med pa ste /
translated: The eye element is not real at all.

original: rnam par rtog pa las skyes so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa las skyes so //
translated: It arises from conceptualization.

original: mig gi khams la nges pa'i mtshan nyid med de /
analyzed: mig gi khams la nges pa'i mtshan nyid med de /
translated: The eye element has no definitive characteristic.

original: nam mkha'i khams ni mig gi khams yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni mig gi khams yin no //
translated: The space element is the eye element.

original: dper na / nam mkha'i khams la des pa'i mtshan nyid med de /
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha'i khams la des pa'i mtshan nyid med de /
translated: For example, just as the space element has no definitive characteristic,

original: dngos po med pa bzhin mig gi khams la nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pa dang / rang dngos po med pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa bzhin mig gi khams la nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pa dang / rang dngos po med pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: the eye element has no definitive characteristic and is itself unreal.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: mig gi khams la yang dag pa'i dngos po mi rnyed pa'i phyir mig gi khams yul na'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: mig gi khams la yang dag pa'i dngos po mi rnyed pa'i phyir mig gi khams yul na'ang mi gnas /
translated: Because a real eye element is not found, the eye element does not exist in the object,

original: phyogs na'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: phyogs na'ang mi gnas /
translated: it does not exist in the direction,

original: nang na'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: nang na'ang mi gnas /
translated: and it does not exist internally.

original: phyi rol na'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang mi gnas /
translated: It does not exist externally.

original: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not exist between these two.

original: mig gi khams la nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pa /
analyzed: mig gi khams la nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pa /
translated: The eye element has no definitive characteristic.

original: dngos po med pas mig gi khams kyi dngos po dmigs su med de /
analyzed: dngos po med pas mig gi khams kyi dngos po dmigs su med de /
translated: Since it is unreal, the reality of the eye element is not perceived.🔽It arises from many causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang rkyen mang po las skyes so; ;mig gi khams 'das pa ma yin /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen mang po las skyes so; ;mig gi khams 'das pa ma yin /
translated: The eye element is not past,

original: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
translated: not future,

original: da ltar gyi ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi ma yin te /
translated: and not present.

original: mig gi khams la mig gi rang bzhin dmigs su med do //
analyzed: mig gi khams la mig gi rang bzhin dmigs su med do //
translated: The nature of the eye element is not perceived.

original: mig gi khams @59b ni sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang / da ltar gyi rkyen la rag lus te /
analyzed: mig gi khams @59b ni sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang / da ltar gyi rkyen la rag lus te /
translated: The eye element is the ripening of the results of past karma and depends on present conditions.

original: mig gi khams zhes btags so //
analyzed: mig gi khams zhes btags so //
translated: It is designated as the eye element.

original: mig gi khams zhes bya ba ni khams med do //
analyzed: mig gi khams zhes bya ba ni khams med do //
translated: What is called the eye element is not an element.

original: mig gi khams la mig gi khams dmigs su med do //
analyzed: mig gi khams la mig gi khams dmigs su med do //
translated: The eye element is not perceived in the eye element.

original: rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul la mig gi khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul la mig gi khams zhes bya'o //
translated: The domain of consciousness is called the eye element.

original: mig gi dbang po'ang rnam par dag la gzugs kyang snang ba'i gnas na yod cing yid kyi dbang por ldan te /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'ang rnam par dag la gzugs kyang snang ba'i gnas na yod cing yid kyi dbang por ldan te /
translated: The eye faculty is pure, and form exists in the realm of appearances, and is endowed with the mental faculty.

original: rnam pa gsum 'dus pa na mig gi khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum 'dus pa na mig gi khams zhes bya'o //
translated: When these three come together, it is called the eye element.

original: mig gi khams la nges par mig gi khams zhes bya ba med de /
analyzed: mig gi khams la nges par mig gi khams zhes bya ba med de /
translated: In the eye element, there is definitely no eye element.

original: mkhas pa dag ni mig gi khams med pa la mig gi khams su rtogs so //
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni mig gi khams med pa la mig gi khams su rtogs so //
translated: The wise understand that the nonexistence of the eye element is the eye element.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams gal te de ltar mig gi khams rnam par 'byed pa rtogs nas khams med pa la gzugs kyi khams su khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams gal te de ltar mig gi khams rnam par 'byed pa rtogs nas khams med pa la gzugs kyi khams su khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: if bodhisattva mahāsattvas understand the discernment of the eye element in this way, they will comprehend the nonexistence of the element in the form element.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gzugs kyi khams la gzugs kyi khams su med de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams la gzugs kyi khams su med de /
translated: In the form element, there is no form element.

original: gzugs kyi khams ni ma 'dus pa ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ni ma 'dus pa ma byas pa'o //
translated: The form element is uncollected and unproduced.

original: gzugs la nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams zhes bya'o //
translated: Because form has no definitive characteristic, it is called the form element.

original: gzugs la dngos po med de rnam par rtog pa'ang med na gzugs kyi khams zhes bya ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: gzugs la dngos po med de rnam par rtog pa'ang med na gzugs kyi khams zhes bya ba lta ci smos te /
translated: If form does not exist as a thing and is also not conceptualized, then how much less could there be a so-called form realm!

original: gzugs kyi khams zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pas gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni gzugs kyi nang na'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pas gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni gzugs kyi nang na'ang mi gnas /
translated: The so-called form realm is not a thing. The characteristics of form do not exist within form,

original: gzugs kyi phyi rol na'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phyi rol na'ang mi gnas /
translated: nor do they exist outside of form,

original: @60a *// gnyis ka'i bar na'ang mi gnas te /
analyzed: @60a *// gnyis ka'i bar na'ang mi gnas te /
translated: nor do they exist in between the two.

original: rnam par brtags pa dang / gzugs mngon du snang ba'i gnas na yod la mig gi dbang po'ang rnam par dag cing yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa las gzugs mngon par snang ste /
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa dang / gzugs mngon du snang ba'i gnas na yod la mig gi dbang po'ang rnam par dag cing yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa las gzugs mngon par snang ste /
translated: When the conceptualization of form and the appearance of form exist, and the eye faculty is pure and endowed with the mental consciousness, then the appearance of form arises.

original: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the characteristic of form.

original: dper na / me long gi nang gi gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dper na / me long gi nang gi gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ste /
translated: It is like a reflection in a mirror.

original: me long yongs su dag na gzugs kyi mtshan nyid mngon par snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me long yongs su dag na gzugs kyi mtshan nyid mngon par snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the mirror is clear, the characteristics of form will appear.

original: gzugs la nges pa'i mtshan nyid med de /
analyzed: gzugs la nges pa'i mtshan nyid med de /
translated: Form has no definitive characteristics.

original: me long gi nang na mi med bzhin du gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan snang ngo //
analyzed: me long gi nang na mi med bzhin du gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan snang ngo //
translated: In a mirror, the reflection of a form appears without there being a person.

original: de'ang phyi rol na me long yod na nang nas gzugs kyi mtshan nyid 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'ang phyi rol na me long yod na nang nas gzugs kyi mtshan nyid 'byung ngo //
translated: Moreover, if there is a mirror on the outside, the characteristics of a form appear on the inside.

original: de bzhin du mig gi dbang po rnam par dag pa na gzugs snang ba'i gnas na 'dug pa la dmigs nas me long gi gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba la gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ces btags so //🔽gzugs la khams med /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig gi dbang po rnam par dag pa na gzugs snang ba'i gnas na 'dug pa la dmigs nas me long gi gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba la gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ces btags so // gzugs la khams med /
translated: In the same way, when the eye faculty is pure, it observes the place where forms appear, and, like a reflection in a mirror, it is designated as the characteristic of form.🔽Form has no realm.

original: dbyibs kyi mtshan ma med /
analyzed: dbyibs kyi mtshan ma med /
translated: It has no characteristics of shape.

original: nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pas gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
