translated: and sharp faculties understand that all phenomena are emptiness, like illusions, unreal, and nonexistent through a mere hint.

original: chos thams cad kyis bus pa so so'i skye bo dag bslus pa dang / chos thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rkyen la rag lus par shes so; ;'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyis bus pa so so'i skye bo dag bslus pa dang / chos thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rkyen la rag lus par shes so; ;'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: They know that all phenomena deceive ordinary, foolish beings, and that all phenomena depend on unreal conditions.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams khams kyi sbyor ba la 'jug par 'dod pa dag shin tu zab mo'i mdo sde brjod du med /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams khams kyi sbyor ba la 'jug par 'dod pa dag shin tu zab mo'i mdo sde brjod du med /
translated: Lokadhara, bodhisattva great beings who wish to engage with the composition of the elements should teach the profound sūtras that are inexpressible,

original: dmigs su med pa /
analyzed: dmigs su med pa /
translated: unobservable,

original: khams thams cad shes shing mthong bar byed pa ston pa /
analyzed: khams thams cad shes shing mthong bar byed pa ston pa /
translated: and reveal the knowledge and vision of all elements.

original: khams thams cad yi ge med pa /
analyzed: khams thams cad yi ge med pa /
translated: They should teach that all elements are beyond letters,

original: 'dus pa med pa /
analyzed: 'dus pa med pa /
translated: beyond aggregation,

original: brjod du med pa /
analyzed: brjod du med pa /
translated: and inexpressible.

original: khams thams cad kyi thabs dang shes rab ston pa /
analyzed: khams thams cad kyi thabs dang shes rab ston pa /
translated: They should teach the methods and wisdom of all elements.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la 'jug par byed pa ston pa /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la 'jug par byed pa ston pa /
translated: They should teach the engagement with dependent origination.

original: gzhan yang / chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa nyid brjod pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang / chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa nyid brjod pa /
translated: Moreover, they should teach the expression of the true nature of all phenomena.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is as follows.

original: 'jig rten dang / 'jig @70a *//
analyzed: 'jig rten dang / 'jig @70a *//
translated: The world and the world beyond,

original: rten las 'das pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa dang / dbang dang / dbang ma yin pa dang / sbyor ba la 'jug pa dang / don dam pa dang / kun rdzob kyi don dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde dang /
analyzed: rten las 'das pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa dang / dbang dang / dbang ma yin pa dang / sbyor ba la 'jug pa dang / don dam pa dang / kun rdzob kyi don dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde dang /
translated: the supramundane, the conditioned, the unconditioned, the empowered, the non-empowered, the engagement in application, the ultimate, the conventional, the sūtras of definitive meaning,🔽the sūtras of provisional meaning, and the profound sūtras of dependent origination and liberation.

original: bkri ba'i don gyi mdo sde dang / rten cing 'brel te byung ba'i rnam par grol ba'i mdo sde zab mo 'di las brjod pa thams cad la brtson par bya'o; ;khams bco brgyad ces bya ba'i le'u ste gsum mo ////
analyzed: bkri ba'i don gyi mdo sde dang / rten cing 'brel te byung ba'i rnam par grol ba'i mdo sde zab mo 'di las brjod pa thams cad la brtson par bya'o; ;khams bco brgyad ces bya ba'i le'u ste gsum mo ////
translated: This concludes the third chapter on the eighteen elements.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin ces bya ba'i mdo /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin ces bya ba'i mdo /
translated: The Sūtra on the World

original: bam po gsum pa /
analyzed: bam po gsum pa /
translated: Fascicle Three

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten 'dzin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten 'dzin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One said to Lokadhara:

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skye mched bcu gnyis la mkhas pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skye mched bcu gnyis la mkhas pa zhe na /
translated: What is it like when a bodhisattva mahāsattva is skilled in the twelve sense bases?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skye mched bcu gnyis rnam par 'byed cing yang dag par rtog pa na 'di snyam du mig la mig gi skye mched dmigs su med /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skye mched bcu gnyis rnam par 'byed cing yang dag par rtog pa na 'di snyam du mig la mig gi skye mched dmigs su med /
translated: When the bodhisattva mahāsattva is discerning and contemplating the twelve sense bases, he thinks like this: ‘The eye sense base is not apprehended in the eye.

original: mig la mig gi skye mched du nges pa med do //
analyzed: mig la mig gi skye mched du nges pa med do //
translated: The eye sense base is not ascertained in the eye.

original: mig gi skye mched kyang dngos por dmigs su med do //
analyzed: mig gi skye mched kyang dngos por dmigs su med do //
translated: The eye sense base is also not apprehended as a thing.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mig gi skye mched ni rkyen mang po las skyes pa phyin ci log las byung ba'o //
analyzed: mig gi skye mched ni rkyen mang po las skyes pa phyin ci log las byung ba'o //
translated: The eye sense base arises from many conditions and comes from error.

original: gzugs la dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs la rag lus pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs la rag lus pa ste /
translated: Because it observes form, it depends on form.

original: gnyis phrad pa las gzugs kyi rkyen gyis mig gi skye mched kyi rkyen yod par gyur te /
analyzed: gnyis phrad pa las gzugs kyi rkyen gyis mig gi skye mched kyi rkyen yod par gyur te /
translated: From the contact of the two, the condition of the eye sense base comes to exist through the condition of form.

original: gzugs dang / mig gi skye mched gnyis gcig la @70b gcig ltos pa'i phyir mig gi gzugs zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzugs dang / mig gi skye mched gnyis gcig la @70b gcig ltos pa'i phyir mig gi gzugs zhes bshad do //
translated: Because the two, form and the eye sense base, depend on each other, it is explained as “the form of the eye.”

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: mig dang / gzugs zhes bya ba gzugs ni mig gi skye mched 'byung bar byed pa'i sgo yin la /
analyzed: mig dang / gzugs zhes bya ba gzugs ni mig gi skye mched 'byung bar byed pa'i sgo yin la /
translated: “The eye and form” means that form is the door that gives rise to the eye sense base.

original: mig kyang gzugs kyi skye mched 'byung zhing snang bar byed pas de bas na skye mched kyang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched kyi sgo zhes btags pas mig gi skye mched ces bya ste /
analyzed: mig kyang gzugs kyi skye mched 'byung zhing snang bar byed pas de bas na skye mched kyang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched kyi sgo zhes btags pas mig gi skye mched ces bya ste /
translated: The eye is also the source of the form source and makes it appear. Therefore, the source is designated as the eye source because the source is the door of the form condition.

original: mig gis mthong ba'i phyir gzugs kyi skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: mig gis mthong ba'i phyir gzugs kyi skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: Because the eye sees, it is called the form source.

original: kun rdzob tu yod par gsungs kyi mig kyang gzugs la mi gnas /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod par gsungs kyi mig kyang gzugs la mi gnas /
translated: It is said to exist conventionally, but the eye does not exist in form,

original: gzugs kyang mig la mi gnas /
analyzed: gzugs kyang mig la mi gnas /
translated: form does not exist in the eye,

original: mig mig la mi gnas /
analyzed: mig mig la mi gnas /
translated: the eye does not exist in the eye,

original: gzugs kyang gzugs la mi gnas te /
analyzed: gzugs kyang gzugs la mi gnas te /
translated: and form does not exist in form.

original: rkyen mang po las gzugs su dmigs pa byung bas mig gi skye mched ces btags so //
analyzed: rkyen mang po las gzugs su dmigs pa byung bas mig gi skye mched ces btags so //
translated: Since the observation of form arises from many conditions, it is designated as the eye source.

original: gzhan yang / rten cing 'brel te byung ba las mig gi shes pa dang / mthong ba'i mtshan nyid skye bas gzugs kyi skye mched ces btags so //
analyzed: gzhan yang / rten cing 'brel te byung ba las mig gi shes pa dang / mthong ba'i mtshan nyid skye bas gzugs kyi skye mched ces btags so //
translated: Moreover, since the eye consciousness and the characteristic of seeing arise from dependent origination, it is designated as the form source.

original: ji ltar na kun rdzob tu phyin ci log tu bshad pa'i zlas don dam par mig gi skye mched dmigs su med cing gzugs kyi skye mched dmigs su med pa bstan pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na kun rdzob tu phyin ci log tu bshad pa'i zlas don dam par mig gi skye mched dmigs su med cing gzugs kyi skye mched dmigs su med pa bstan pa zhe na /
translated: How is it that, in contrast to the explanation of the conventional as erroneous, the eye-source is not observed ultimately, and the form-source is not observed?

original: mkhas pa dag ni skye mched rnams btsal na yang dag par yod par mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni skye mched rnams btsal na yang dag par yod par mi mthong ste /
translated: The wise, when investigating the sources, do not see them as really existing.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo blo phyin ci log tu gyur pa dag ni mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched mtshan ma gnyis su 'chad do //
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo blo phyin ci log tu gyur pa dag ni mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched mtshan ma gnyis su 'chad do //
translated: Childlike ordinary beings, whose minds are erroneous, explain the eye-source and the form-source as two signs.

original: mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched de nyid yang dag pa ma @71a *//🔽yin pa'i skye mched bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched de nyid yang dag pa ma @71a *// yin pa'i skye mched bstan pa'o //
translated: The eye-source and the form-source are taught as unreal sources.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos rnams kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid shes bar bya ba'i phyir skye mched rnams ni rten cing 'brel te byung ba phyin ci log tu mngon par 'byed pa dang ldan pa las byung ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos rnams kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid shes bar bya ba'i phyir skye mched rnams ni rten cing 'brel te byung ba phyin ci log tu mngon par 'byed pa dang ldan pa las byung ste /
translated: In order to know the characteristic of reality of phenomena just as it is, the sources arise from the dependent origination endowed with the differentiation of error.

original: skye mched kyi mtshan nyid du yang dag par dmigs su med do //
analyzed: skye mched kyi mtshan nyid du yang dag par dmigs su med do //
translated: The characteristics of the sense bases are not truly apprehended.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched nang na mi gnas /
analyzed: mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched nang na mi gnas /
translated: The eye sense base and the form sense base do not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na mi gnas /
analyzed: phyi rol na mi gnas /
translated: do not exist externally,

original: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas so //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas so //
translated: and do not exist in between.

original: mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched 'das pa ma yin; ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched 'das pa ma yin; ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
translated: The eye sense base and the form sense base are not past, are not future,

original: da ltar gyi ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi ma yin te /
translated: and are not present.

original: 'on kyang da ltar gyi rgyu dang / rkyen 'dus pa las gzugs su shes pas mig gi skye mched du brjod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang da ltar gyi rgyu dang / rkyen 'dus pa las gzugs su shes pas mig gi skye mched du brjod de /
translated: However, because of the present aggregation of causes and conditions, form is cognized, and therefore it is called the eye sense base.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag spyod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo dag spyod pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the behavior of foolish, ordinary beings.

original: mkhas pa dag ni skye mched rnams yang dag pa ma yin pa ci'ang med pa /
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni skye mched rnams yang dag pa ma yin pa ci'ang med pa /
translated: The wise understand that the sense bases are completely nonexistent,

original: rnam par brtags pa'i phyin ci log las byung bar khong du chud pas skye mched ma yin pa ni skye mched du mthong zhing shes so //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i phyin ci log las byung bar khong du chud pas skye mched ma yin pa ni skye mched du mthong zhing shes so //
translated: arising from the error of conceptual imputation. Therefore, they see and know that what is not a sense base is a sense base.

original: skye mched kyi mtshan nyid mi brjod cing skye mched la mtshan nyid nges pa med do //
analyzed: skye mched kyi mtshan nyid mi brjod cing skye mched la mtshan nyid nges pa med do //
translated: The characteristics of the sense-spheres are not described, and the sense-spheres have no definite characteristics.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung bar de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung bar de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
translated: The Tathāgata has taught that they arise in dependence.

original: de dag ni skye mched du mthong ba dang / shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni skye mched du mthong ba dang / shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called the sense-spheres because they are seen and known.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: skye mched rnams ni yang dag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: skye mched rnams ni yang dag pa ma yin pa /
translated: The sense-spheres are not real,

original: ci'ang med pa /
analyzed: ci'ang med pa /
translated: they are nothing at all,

original: rgyu dang / rkyen la rag lus @71b pa; phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i 'du byed las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen la rag lus @71b pa; phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i 'du byed las byung ba'o //
translated: they arise from formations that are dependent on causes and conditions, and are associated with error.

original: skye mched ni byas pa med pa /
analyzed: skye mched ni byas pa med pa /
translated: The sense-spheres are not created,

original: byed pa med de /
analyzed: byed pa med de /
translated: they are not agents.

original: mig gi skye mched gzugs kyi skye mched du rnam par mi rtog /
analyzed: mig gi skye mched gzugs kyi skye mched du rnam par mi rtog /
translated: The sense-sphere of the eye does not conceptualize the sense-sphere of form,

original: gzugs kyi skye mched kyang mig gi skye mched du mi shes rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched kyang mig gi skye mched du mi shes rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: and the sense-sphere of form does not know or conceptualize the sense-sphere of the eye.

original: gnyis ka'i mtshan ma dang bral ba'o zhes chos nyid kyis 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid kyis na de la rnam par brtag cing brjod du med do //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i mtshan ma dang bral ba'o zhes chos nyid kyis 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid kyis na de la rnam par brtag cing brjod du med do //
translated: Because they are characterized by being connected by the nature of phenomena, they cannot be conceptualized or described in that way.

original: skye mched kyi mtshan nyid ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung bas bus pas phyin ci log tu shes pa dang / 'phags pas khong du chud cing rtogs par ji bzhin te /
analyzed: skye mched kyi mtshan nyid ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung bas bus pas phyin ci log tu shes pa dang / 'phags pas khong du chud cing rtogs par ji bzhin te /
translated: The characteristics of the sense sources are that they are produced in dependence, and so are wrongly understood by the childish, while the noble ones comprehend and realize them as they are.

original: mig gi skye mched dang; gzugs kyi skye mched ni ma skyes pa /
analyzed: mig gi skye mched dang; gzugs kyi skye mched ni ma skyes pa /
translated: The sense source of the eye and the sense source of form are unborn,

original: mi 'gag pa /
analyzed: mi 'gag pa /
translated: unceasing,

original: ma 'ongs pa /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa /
translated: non-arisen,

original: mi 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid yin pas mig gis mig mi shes /
analyzed: mi 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid yin pas mig gis mig mi shes /
translated: and have the characteristic of non-going. Therefore, the eye does not know the eye.

original: mig gis mig tu rnam par mi rtog /
analyzed: mig gis mig tu rnam par mi rtog /
translated: The eye does not conceive of the eye.

original: gzugs kyis gzugs mi shes /
analyzed: gzugs kyis gzugs mi shes /
translated: Form does not know form.

original: gzugs kyis gzugs su rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: gzugs kyis gzugs su rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: Form does not conceive of form.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gnyis ka stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both are empty.

original: gnyis ka bral ba'i phyir mig gis mig gi mtshan nyid mi shes /
analyzed: gnyis ka bral ba'i phyir mig gis mig gi mtshan nyid mi shes /
translated: Because both are free, the eye does not know the characteristic of the eye.

original: gzugs kyis gzugs kyi mtshan nyid mi shes /
analyzed: gzugs kyis gzugs kyi mtshan nyid mi shes /
translated: Form does not know the characteristic of form.

original: mig dang / gzugs gnyis ka la mtshan nyid med /
analyzed: mig dang / gzugs gnyis ka la mtshan nyid med /
translated: Neither the eye nor form have characteristics.

original: chos med de /
analyzed: chos med de /
translated: There are no phenomena.

original: de la nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pas mig gis mig ma byas /
analyzed: de la nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pas mig gis mig ma byas /
translated: Since there are no definitive characteristics there, the eye does not create the eye.

original: mig gis mig tu mi shes so //
analyzed: mig gis mig tu mi shes so //
translated: The eye does not know the eye.

original: gzugs kyis gzugs ma byas /
analyzed: gzugs kyis gzugs ma byas /
translated: Form does not create form.

original: gzugs kyis gzugs mi shes so //
analyzed: gzugs kyis gzugs mi shes so //
translated: Form does not know form.

original: gnyis ka med pa'i phyir mig kyang bdag go snyam du @72a *//
analyzed: gnyis ka med pa'i phyir mig kyang bdag go snyam du @72a *//
translated: Because neither exists, the eye does not think, ‘I am the self,’

original: mi sems / gzugs kyang bdag ni gzugs so snyam du mi sems /
analyzed: mi sems / gzugs kyang bdag ni gzugs so snyam du mi sems /
translated: and form does not think, ‘I am form.’

original: mig dang / gzugs kyi bdag nyid ni sgyu ma'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: mig dang / gzugs kyi bdag nyid ni sgyu ma'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The nature of the eye and form is that of an illusion.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i bla dvags su mig dang / gzugs zhes brjod do //🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched la ji ltar rnam par 'byed cing rtog pa bzhin du rna ba dang / sgra dang / sna dang / dri dang / lce dang / ro dang / lus dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i bla dvags su mig dang / gzugs zhes brjod do // byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched la ji ltar rnam par 'byed cing rtog pa bzhin du rna ba dang / sgra dang / sna dang / dri dang / lce dang / ro dang / lus dang /
translated: It is said that the eye and form are not real designations.

original: reg bya'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: reg bya'ang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as bodhisattvas discern and contemplate the sense base of the eye and the sense base of form, they also do so with regard to the ear and sound, the nose and smell, the tongue and taste, the body and touch,🔽and the mind and mental phenomena.

original: 'jig rten 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dzin /
translated: Lokadhara,

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yid kyi skye mched la rnam par 'byed cing rtog pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yid kyi skye mched la rnam par 'byed cing rtog pa zhe na /
translated: how do bodhisattva mahāsattvas discern and contemplate the sense base of the mind?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yid kyi skye mched la rnam par 'byed cing rtog pa'i tshe de 'di snyam du yid kyi skye mched dmigs su med /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yid kyi skye mched la rnam par 'byed cing rtog pa'i tshe de 'di snyam du yid kyi skye mched dmigs su med /
translated: When bodhisattva-mahāsattvas discern and contemplate the mental sense base, they think like this: The mental sense base is unobservable.

original: yid la skye mched du nges pa'i mtshan nyid med de /
analyzed: yid la skye mched du nges pa'i mtshan nyid med de /
translated: The mental sense base has no definitive characteristic.

original: yid kyi skye mched la dngos po med par sems so //
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched la dngos po med par sems so //
translated: The mental sense base is considered to be unreal.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yid kyi skye mched ni rten cing 'brel te byung bas phyin ci log las skyes te /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched ni rten cing 'brel te byung bas phyin ci log las skyes te /
translated: The mental sense base arises in dependence, born from error.

original: chos kyi skye mched las rag lus pas gnyis phrad pa las bya ba med par 'gyur ro //🔽yid kyi skye mched kyang chos kyi skye mched kyi rkyen gyis 'byung la /
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched las rag lus pas gnyis phrad pa las bya ba med par 'gyur ro // yid kyi skye mched kyang chos kyi skye mched kyi rkyen gyis 'byung la /
translated: Since it depends on the sense base of mental objects, it does not function through the contact of the two.🔽The mental sense base arises due to the condition of the sense base of mental objects.

original: chos kyi skye mched kyi rkyen gyis rnam par 'byed par gyur te /
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched kyi rkyen gyis rnam par 'byed par gyur te /
translated: Due to the condition of the sense base of mental objects, it becomes discernment.

original: mtshan nyid gnyis su phye'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gnyis su phye'o //
translated: It is divided into two characteristics.

original: yid la brten nas chos kyi @72b skye mched kyi gnas yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid la brten nas chos kyi @72b skye mched kyi gnas yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Based on the mind, the basis of the sense base of mental objects exists.

original: yid ni chos skye zhing mched par byed pa'i sgo yin la chos kyi skye mched kyang yid kyi sgo yin no //
analyzed: yid ni chos skye zhing mched par byed pa'i sgo yin la chos kyi skye mched kyang yid kyi sgo yin no //
translated: The mind is the door through which phenomena arise and develop, and the sense-field of phenomena is also the door of the mind.

original: de bas na chos kyi skye mched ces gdags so //
analyzed: de bas na chos kyi skye mched ces gdags so //
translated: Therefore, it is designated as the sense-field of phenomena.

original: chos kyi skye mched kyi sgo'i rkyen gyis yid kyi skye mched du brjod de /
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched kyi sgo'i rkyen gyis yid kyi skye mched du brjod de /
translated: The sense-field of the mind is described as the sense-field of phenomena because it is the condition that is the door of the sense-field of phenomena.

original: yid kyi mtshan nyid kyi sgo bstan cing shes par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi skye mched ces brjod par gyur to //
analyzed: yid kyi mtshan nyid kyi sgo bstan cing shes par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi skye mched ces brjod par gyur to //
translated: In order to reveal and make known the door that is the characteristic of the mind, it is called the sense-field of phenomena.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa yang dag par bshad kyi yid kyang chos la mi brten chos kyang yid la mi brten te /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa yang dag par bshad kyi yid kyang chos la mi brten chos kyang yid la mi brten te /
translated: The conventional truth is explained correctly. The mind does not depend on phenomena, and phenomena do not depend on the mind.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung bas chos rnams rkyen du gyur te yid kyi skye mched ces bshad do; ;rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dang / yid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung bas chos rnams rkyen du gyur te yid kyi skye mched ces bshad do; ;rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dang / yid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of dependent origination, phenomena become conditions, and the sense-field of the mind is explained. In order to reveal dependent origination and the characteristic of the mind,

original: chos kyi skye mched brjod de /
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched brjod de /
translated: the sense-field of phenomena is described.

original: kun rdzob tu phyin ci log bshad pa'i zlas don dam par yid kyi skye mched dmigs su med /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu phyin ci log bshad pa'i zlas don dam par yid kyi skye mched dmigs su med /
translated: By contrast, in the ultimate sense, the mental faculty and the mental objects are unobservable.

original: chos kyi skye mched dmigs su med par gsungs so //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched dmigs su med par gsungs so //
translated: The mental faculty and mental objects are said to be unobservable.

original: mkhas pa dag ni skye mched la rnam par brtags na yang dag par yod par mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni skye mched la rnam par brtags na yang dag par yod par mi mthong ngo //
translated: The wise, when they investigate the sense sources, do not see them as real.

original: bus pa so so'i skye bo blo phyin ci log tu gyur pa dag ni yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched ces mtshan ma rnam pa gnyis su brjod do //
analyzed: bus pa so so'i skye bo blo phyin ci log tu gyur pa dag ni yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched ces mtshan ma rnam pa gnyis su brjod do //
translated: The childish, ordinary beings, whose minds are distorted, speak of two kinds of mental objects: the mental faculty and mental objects.

original: yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched ni yang dag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched ni yang dag pa ma yin pa /
translated: The mental faculty and mental objects are unreal,

original: ci'ang med pa de kho na nyid ji bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud pas skye mched ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'ang med pa de kho na nyid ji bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud pas skye mched ces gsungs so //
translated: nonexistent, and empty. The Thus-Gone One has realized the way things really are and has therefore taught them to be the sense sources.

original: skye mched rnams ni rten cing 'brel te byung ba phyin ci @73a *//
analyzed: skye mched rnams ni rten cing 'brel te byung ba phyin ci @73a *//
translated: The sense sources are dependently arisen and distorted.

original: log dang ldan pa'i 'du byed las byung bas de la ni yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched du yang dag par dmigs su med do //
analyzed: log dang ldan pa'i 'du byed las byung bas de la ni yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched du yang dag par dmigs su med do //
translated: Since it arises from formations that are associated with error, it cannot be apprehended as the mental faculty or the phenomena element.

original: yid kyi skye mched dang; chos kyi skye mched ni nang na mi gnas /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched dang; chos kyi skye mched ni nang na mi gnas /
translated: The mental faculty and the phenomena element do not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na mi gnas /
analyzed: phyi rol na mi gnas /
translated: nor do they exist externally,

original: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas so //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar na mi gnas so //
translated: nor do they exist between the two.

original: gzhan yang / yid kyi skye mched ni 'das pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang / yid kyi skye mched ni 'das pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Moreover, the mental faculty is not past,

original: ma 'ongs pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'ang ma yin /
translated: nor is it future,

original: da ltar gyi'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi'ang ma yin te /
translated: nor is it present.

original: da ltar gyi 'phral gyi rkyen shes pa las bus pa so so'i skye bos bsams pas rjes su yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched ces brjod do //
analyzed: da ltar gyi 'phral gyi rkyen shes pa las bus pa so so'i skye bos bsams pas rjes su yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched ces brjod do //
translated: The childish, ordinary beings think that the mental faculty is a present, immediate condition, and they refer to it as the mental faculty and the phenomena element.

original: mkhas pa dag ni yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched la yang dag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched la yang dag pa ma yin pa /
translated: The wise, however, know that the mental faculty and the phenomena element are unreal,

original: ci'ang med pa /
analyzed: ci'ang med pa /
translated: nonexistent,🔽and empty.

original: phyin ci log tu rnam par rtog pa las byung ba skye mched ma yin pa la skye mched du khong du chud par rtogs so //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu rnam par rtog pa las byung ba skye mched ma yin pa la skye mched du khong du chud par rtogs so //
translated: He understands that the sense-spheres arise from false imagination, and that the non-sense-spheres are comprehended as sense-spheres.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: skye mched rnams la nges par skye mched kyi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched rnams la nges par skye mched kyi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the sense-spheres do not have the characteristics of sense-spheres.

original: mkhas pa dag ni de ltar skye mched rnams la yang dag pa ma yin pa ci'ang med par rtogs te /
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni de ltar skye mched rnams la yang dag pa ma yin pa ci'ang med par rtogs te /
translated: The wise ones thus understand that the sense-spheres are completely non-existent.

original: yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched rang bzhin gyis dmigs su med /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched rang bzhin gyis dmigs su med /
translated: The sense-sphere of the mind and the sense-sphere of mental objects are essentially unobservable.

original: yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched las byung ba de kho na'i mtshan nyid du'ang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched las byung ba de kho na'i mtshan nyid du'ang mi dmigs so //
translated: What arises from the sense-sphere of the mind and the sense-sphere of mental objects is also unobservable as the characteristic of reality.

original: de ltar yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched ni rten cing 'brel te byung bas de bzhin gshegs pas kyang skye mched rnams kyi shes pa dang / mthong @73b ba'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched ni rten cing 'brel te byung bas de bzhin gshegs pas kyang skye mched rnams kyi shes pa dang / mthong @73b ba'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa ni /
translated: Thus, the sense-sphere of the mind and the sense-sphere of mental objects are dependently arisen. The Tathāgata also taught the characteristics of the knowledge and vision of the sense-spheres.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: skye mched rnams yang dag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: skye mched rnams yang dag pa ma yin pa /
translated: The sense-spheres are not real.
